124 
125 class Response
126 {
127 public:
128  Response(int code = 0)
129  : m_code(code)
130  , m_data()
131  { }
132 
133  Response(int code, std::vector<char> data)
134  : m_code(code)
135  , m_data(data)
136  { }
137 
138  Response(
139  int code,
140  const std::vector<char>& data,
141  const Headers& headers)
142  : m_code(code)
143  , m_data(data)
144  , m_headers(headers)
145  { }
146 
147  ~Response() { }
148 
149  bool ok() const { return m_code / 100 == 2; }
150  bool clientError() const { return m_code / 100 == 4; }
151  bool serverError() const { return m_code / 100 == 5; }
152  int code() const { return m_code; }
153 
154  std::vector<char> data() const { return m_data; }
155  const Headers& headers() const { return m_headers; }
156 
157 private:
158  int m_code;
159  std::vector<char> m_data;
160  Headers m_headers;
161 };

567 class HttpPool;
568 
569 /** @brief Base class for interacting with a storage type.
570  *
571  * A Driver handles reading, writing, and possibly globbing from a storage
572  * source. It is intended to be overriden by specialized subclasses for each
573  * supported storage mechanism.
574  *
575  * Derived classes must override Driver::type,
576  * Driver::put(std::string, const std::vector<char>&) const, and
577  * Driver::get(std::string, std::vector<char>&) const,
578  * Driver::getSize(std::string) const - and may optionally
579  * override Driver::glob if possible.
580  *
581  * HTTP-derived classes should override the PUT and GET versions that accept
582  * http::Headers and http::Query parameters instead.
583  */
584 class Driver
585 {
586 public:
587  virtual ~Driver() { }
588 
589  /**
590  * Returns a string identifying this driver type, which should be unique
591  * among all other drivers. Paths that begin with the substring
592  * `<type>://` will be routed to this driver. For example, `fs`, `s3`, or
593  * `http`.
594  *
595  * @note Derived classes must override.
596  */
597  virtual std::string type() const = 0;
598 
599  /** Get string data. */
600  std::string get(std::string path) const;
601 
602  /** Get string data, if available. */
603  std::unique_ptr<std::string> tryGet(std::string path) const;
604 
605  /** Get binary data. */
606  std::vector<char> getBinary(std::string path) const;
607 
608  /** Get binary data, if available. */
609  std::unique_ptr<std::vector<char>> tryGetBinary(std::string path) const;
610 
611  /**
612  * Write @p data to the given @p path.
613  *
614  * @note Derived classes must override.
615  *
616  * @param path Path with the type-specifying prefix information stripped.
617  */
618  virtual void put(std::string path, const std::vector<char>& data) const = 0;
619 
620  /** True for remote paths, otherwise false. If `true`, a fs::LocalHandle
621  * request will download and write this file to the local filesystem.
622  */
623  virtual bool isRemote() const { return true; }
624 
625  /** Get the file size in bytes, if available. */
626  virtual std::unique_ptr<std::size_t> tryGetSize(std::string path) const = 0;
627 
628  /** Get the file size in bytes, or throw if it does not exist. */
629  std::size_t getSize(std::string path) const;
630 
631  /** Write string data. */
632  void put(std::string path, const std::string& data) const;
633 
634  /** Copy a file, where @p src and @p dst must both be of this driver
635  * type. Type-prefixes must be stripped from the input parameters.
636  */
637  virtual void copy(std::string src, std::string dst) const;
638 
639  /** @brief Resolve a possibly globbed path.
640  *
641  * See Arbiter::resolve for details.
642  */
643  std::vector<std::string> resolve(
644  std::string path,
645  bool verbose = false) const;
646 
647 protected:
648  /** @brief Resolve a wildcard path.
649  *
650  * This operation should return a non-recursive resolution of the files
651  * matching the given wildcard @p path (no directories). With the exception
652  * of the filesystem Driver, results should be prefixed with
653  * `type() + "://"`.
654  *
655  * @note The default behavior is to throw ArbiterError, so derived classes
656  * may optionally override if they can perform this behavior.
657  *
658  * @param path A string ending with the character `*`, and with all
659  * type-specifying prefix information like `http://` or `s3://` stripped.
660  *
661  * @param verbose If true, this function may print out minimal information
662  * to indicate that progress is occurring.
663  */
664  virtual std::vector<std::string> glob(std::string path, bool verbose) const;
665 
666  /**
667  * @param path Path with the type-specifying prefix information stripped.
668  * @param[out] data Empty vector in which to write resulting data.
669  */
670  virtual bool get(std::string path, std::vector<char>& data) const = 0;
671 };
672

725 /**
726  * \addtogroup fs
727  * @{
728  */
729 
730 /** Filesystem utilities. */
731 namespace fs
732 {
733  /** @brief Returns true if created, false if already existed. */
734  ARBITER_DLL bool mkdirp(std::string dir);
735 
736  /** @brief Returns true if removed, otherwise false. */
737  ARBITER_DLL bool remove(std::string filename);
738 
739  /** @brief Performs tilde expansion to a fully-qualified path, if possible.
740  */
741  ARBITER_DLL std::string expandTilde(std::string path);
742 
743  /** @brief Get temporary path from environment. */
744  ARBITER_DLL std::string getTempPath();
745 
746  /** @brief Resolve a possible wildcard path. */
747  ARBITER_DLL std::vector<std::string> glob(std::string path);
748 
749  /** @brief A scoped local filehandle for a possibly remote path.
750  *
751  * This is an RAII style pseudo-filehandle. It manages the scope of a
752  * local temporary version of a file, where that file may have been copied
753  * from a remote storage location.
754  *
755  * See Arbiter::getLocalHandle for details about construction.
756  */
757  class ARBITER_DLL LocalHandle
758  {
759  friend class arbiter::Arbiter;
760 
761  public:
762  /** @brief Deletes the local path if the data was copied from a remote
763  * source.
764  *
765  * This is a no-op if the path was already local and not copied.
766  */
767  ~LocalHandle();
768 
769  /** @brief Get the path of the locally stored file.
770  *
771  * @return A local filesystem absolute path containing the data
772  * requested in Arbiter::getLocalHandle.
773  */
774  std::string localPath() const { return m_localPath; }
775 
776  /** @brief Release the managed local path and return the path from
777  * LocalHandle::localPath.
778  *
779  * After this call, destruction of the LocalHandle will not erase the
780  * temporary file that may have been created.
781  */
782  std::string release()
783  {
784  m_erase = false;
785  return localPath();
786  }
787 
788  private:
789  LocalHandle(std::string localPath, bool isRemote);
790 
791  const std::string m_localPath;
792  bool m_erase;
793  };
794 }

871 /** @brief HTTP driver. Intended as both a standalone driver as well as a base
872  * for derived drivers build atop HTTP.
873  *
874  * Derivers should overload the HTTP-specific put/get methods that accept
875  * headers and query parameters rather than Driver::put and Driver::get.
876  *
877  * Internal methods for derivers are provided as protected methods.
878  */
879 class ARBITER_DLL Http : public Driver
880 {
881 public:
882  Http(http::Pool& pool);
883  static std::unique_ptr<Http> create(
884  http::Pool& pool,
885  const Json::Value& json);
886 
887  // Inherited from Driver.
888  virtual std::string type() const override { return "http"; }
889 
890  /** By default, performs a HEAD request and returns the contents of the
891  * Content-Length header.
892  */
893  virtual std::unique_ptr<std::size_t> tryGetSize(
894  std::string path) const override;
895 
896  virtual void put(
897  std::string path,
898  const std::vector<char>& data) const final override
899  {
900  put(path, data, http::Headers(), http::Query());
901  }
902 
903  /* HTTP-specific driver methods follow. Since many drivers (S3, Dropbox,
904  * etc.) are built atop HTTP, we'll provide HTTP-specific methods for
905  * derived classes to use in addition to the generic PUT/GET combinations.
906  *
907  * Specifically, we'll add POST/HEAD calls, and allow headers and query
908  * parameters to be passed as well.
909  */
910 
911  /** Perform an HTTP GET request. */
912  std::string get(
913  std::string path,
914  http::Headers headers = http::Headers(),
915  http::Query query = http::Query()) const;
916 
917  /** Perform an HTTP GET request. */
918  std::unique_ptr<std::string> tryGet(
919  std::string path,
920  http::Headers headers = http::Headers(),
921  http::Query query = http::Query()) const;
922 
923  /** Perform an HTTP GET request. */
924  std::vector<char> getBinary(
925  std::string path,
926  http::Headers headers,
927  http::Query query) const;
928 
929  /** Perform an HTTP GET request. */
930  std::unique_ptr<std::vector<char>> tryGetBinary(
931  std::string path,
932  http::Headers headers,
933  http::Query query) const;
934 
935  /** Perform an HTTP PUT request. */
936  void put(
937  std::string path,
938  const std::string& data,
939  http::Headers headers,
940  http::Query query) const;
941 
942  /** HTTP-derived Drivers should override this version of PUT to allow for
943  * custom headers and query parameters.
944  */
945 
946  /** Perform an HTTP PUT request. */
947  virtual void put(
948  std::string path,
949  const std::vector<char>& data,
950  http::Headers headers,
951  http::Query query) const;
952 
953 protected:
954  /** HTTP-derived Drivers should override this version of GET to allow for
955  * custom headers and query parameters.
956  */
957  virtual bool get(
958  std::string path,
959  std::vector<char>& data,
960  http::Headers headers,
961  http::Query query) const;
962 
963  /* These operations are other HTTP-specific calls that derived drivers may
964  * need for their underlying API use.
965  */
966  http::Response internalGet(
967  std::string path,
968  http::Headers headers = http::Headers(),
969  http::Query query = http::Query(),
970  std::size_t reserve = 0) const;
971 
972  http::Response internalPut(
973  std::string path,
974  const std::vector<char>& data,
975  http::Headers headers = http::Headers(),
976  http::Query query = http::Query()) const;
977 
978  http::Response internalHead(
979  std::string path,
980  http::Headers headers = http::Headers(),
981  http::Query query = http::Query()) const;
982 
983  http::Response internalPost(
984  std::string path,
985  const std::vector<char>& data,
986  http::Headers headers = http::Headers(),
987  http::Query query = http::Query()) const;
988 
989 private:
990  virtual bool get(
991  std::string path,
992  std::vector<char>& data) const final override
993  {
994  return get(path, data, http::Headers(), http::Query());
995  }
996 
997  std::string typedPath(const std::string& p) const
998  {
999  return type() + "://" + p;
1000  }
1001 
1002  http::Pool& m_pool;
1003 };
1004

1006  * string.

1097 namespace rapidxml
1098 {
1099  //! When exceptions are disabled by defining RAPIDXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS,
1100  //! this function is called to notify user about the error.
1101  //! It must be defined by the user.
1102  //! <br><br>
1103  //! This function cannot return. If it does, the results are undefined.
1104  //! <br><br>
1105  //! A very simple definition might look like that:
1106  //! <pre>
1107  //! void %rapidxml::%parse_error_handler(const char *what, void *where)
1108  //! {
1109  //! std::cout << "Parse error: " << what << "\n";
1110  //! std::abort();
1111  //! }
1112  //! </pre>
1113  //! \param what Human readable description of the error.
1114  //! \param where Pointer to character data where error was detected.
1115  void parse_error_handler(const char *what, void *where);
1116 }
1117 
1118 #else
1119 
1120 #include <exception> // For std::exception
1121 
1122 #define RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR(what, where) throw parse_error(what, where)
1123 
1124 namespace rapidxml
1125 {
1126 
1127  //! Parse error exception.
1128  //! This exception is thrown by the parser when an error occurs.
1129  //! Use what() function to get human-readable error message.
1130  //! Use where() function to get a pointer to position within source text where error was detected.
1131  //! <br><br>
1132  //! If throwing exceptions by the parser is undesirable,
1133  //! it can be disabled by defining RAPIDXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS macro before rapidxml.hpp is included.
1134  //! This will cause the parser to call rapidxml::parse_error_handler() function instead of throwing an exception.
1135  //! This function must be defined by the user.
1136  //! <br><br>
1137  //! This class derives from <code>std::exception</code> class.
1138  class parse_error: public std::exception
1139  {
1140 
1141  public:
1142 
1143  //! Constructs parse error
1144  parse_error(const char *what, void *where)
1145  : m_what(what)
1146  , m_where(where)
1147  {
1148  }
1149 
1150  //! Gets human readable description of error.
1151  //! \return Pointer to null terminated description of the error.
1152  virtual const char *what() const throw()
1153  {
1154  return m_what;
1155  }
1156 
1157  //! Gets pointer to character data where error happened.
1158  //! Ch should be the same as char type of xml_document that produced the error.
1159  //! \return Pointer to location within the parsed string where error occured.
1160  template<class Ch>
1161  Ch *where() const
1162  {
1163  return reinterpret_cast<Ch *>(m_where);
1164  }
1165 
1166  private:
1167 
1168  const char *m_what;
1169  void *m_where;
1170 
1171  };
1172 }
1173 
1174 #endif

1177 // Pool sizes
1178 
1179 #ifndef RAPIDXML_STATIC_POOL_SIZE
1180  // Size of static memory block of memory_pool.
1181  // Define RAPIDXML_STATIC_POOL_SIZE before including rapidxml.hpp if you want to override the default value.
1182  // No dynamic memory allocations are performed by memory_pool until static memory is exhausted.
1183  #define RAPIDXML_STATIC_POOL_SIZE (64 * 1024)
1184 #endif
1185 
1186 #ifndef RAPIDXML_DYNAMIC_POOL_SIZE
1187  // Size of dynamic memory block of memory_pool.
1188  // Define RAPIDXML_DYNAMIC_POOL_SIZE before including rapidxml.hpp if you want to override the default value.
1189  // After the static block is exhausted, dynamic blocks with approximately this size are allocated by memory_pool.
1190  #define RAPIDXML_DYNAMIC_POOL_SIZE (64 * 1024)
1191 #endif
1192 
1193 #ifndef RAPIDXML_ALIGNMENT
1194  // Memory allocation alignment.
1195  // Define RAPIDXML_ALIGNMENT before including rapidxml.hpp if you want to override the default value, which is the size of pointer.
1196  // All memory allocations for nodes, attributes and strings will be aligned to this value.
1197  // This must be a power of 2 and at least 1, otherwise memory_pool will not work.
1198  #define RAPIDXML_ALIGNMENT sizeof(void *)
1199 #endif

1201 namespace rapidxml
1202 {
1203  // Forward declarations
1204  template<class Ch> class xml_node;
1205  template<class Ch> class xml_attribute;
1206  template<class Ch> class xml_document;
1207 
1208  //! Enumeration listing all node types produced by the parser.
1209  //! Use xml_node::type() function to query node type.
1210  enum node_type
1211  {
1212  node_document, //!< A document node. Name and value are empty.
1213  node_element, //!< An element node. Name contains element name. Value contains text of first data node.
1214  node_data, //!< A data node. Name is empty. Value contains data text.
1215  node_cdata, //!< A CDATA node. Name is empty. Value contains data text.
1216  node_comment, //!< A comment node. Name is empty. Value contains comment text.
1217  node_declaration, //!< A declaration node. Name and value are empty. Declaration parameters (version, encoding and standalone) are in node attributes.
1218  node_doctype, //!< A DOCTYPE node. Name is empty. Value contains DOCTYPE text.
1219  node_pi //!< A PI node. Name contains target. Value contains instructions.
1220  };
1221 
1222  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1223  // Parsing flags
1224 
1225  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to not create data nodes.
1226  //! Text of first data node will still be placed in value of parent element, unless rapidxml::parse_no_element_values flag is also specified.
1227  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1228  //! <br><br>
1229  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1230  const int parse_no_data_nodes = 0x1;
1231 
1232  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to not use text of first data node as a value of parent element.
1233  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1234  //! Note that child data nodes of element node take precendence over its value when printing.
1235  //! That is, if element has one or more child data nodes <em>and</em> a value, the value will be ignored.
1236  //! Use rapidxml::parse_no_data_nodes flag to prevent creation of data nodes if you want to manipulate data using values of elements.
1237  //! <br><br>
1238  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1239  const int parse_no_element_values = 0x2;
1240 
1241  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to not place zero terminators after strings in the source text.
1242  //! By default zero terminators are placed, modifying source text.
1243  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1244  //! <br><br>
1245  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1246  const int parse_no_string_terminators = 0x4;
1247 
1248  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to not translate entities in the source text.
1249  //! By default entities are translated, modifying source text.
1250  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1251  //! <br><br>
1252  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1253  const int parse_no_entity_translation = 0x8;
1254 
1255  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to disable UTF-8 handling and assume plain 8 bit characters.
1256  //! By default, UTF-8 handling is enabled.
1257  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1258  //! <br><br>
1259  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1260  const int parse_no_utf8 = 0x10;
1261 
1262  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to create XML declaration node.
1263  //! By default, declaration node is not created.
1264  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1265  //! <br><br>
1266  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1267  const int parse_declaration_node = 0x20;
1268 
1269  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to create comments nodes.
1270  //! By default, comment nodes are not created.
1271  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1272  //! <br><br>
1273  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1274  const int parse_comment_nodes = 0x40;
1275 
1276  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to create DOCTYPE node.
1277  //! By default, doctype node is not created.
1278  //! Although W3C specification allows at most one DOCTYPE node, RapidXml will silently accept documents with more than one.
1279  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1280  //! <br><br>
1281  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1282  const int parse_doctype_node = 0x80;
1283 
1284  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to create PI nodes.
1285  //! By default, PI nodes are not created.
1286  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1287  //! <br><br>
1288  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1289  const int parse_pi_nodes = 0x100;
1290 
1291  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to validate closing tag names.
1292  //! If not set, name inside closing tag is irrelevant to the parser.
1293  //! By default, closing tags are not validated.
1294  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1295  //! <br><br>
1296  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1297  const int parse_validate_closing_tags = 0x200;
1298 
1299  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to trim all leading and trailing whitespace of data nodes.
1300  //! By default, whitespace is not trimmed.
1301  //! This flag does not cause the parser to modify source text.
1302  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1303  //! <br><br>
1304  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1305  const int parse_trim_whitespace = 0x400;
1306 
1307  //! Parse flag instructing the parser to condense all whitespace runs of data nodes to a single space character.
1308  //! Trimming of leading and trailing whitespace of data is controlled by rapidxml::parse_trim_whitespace flag.
1309  //! By default, whitespace is not normalized.
1310  //! If this flag is specified, source text will be modified.
1311  //! Can be combined with other flags by use of | operator.
1312  //! <br><br>
1313  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1314  const int parse_normalize_whitespace = 0x800;
1315 
1316  // Compound flags
1317 
1318  //! Parse flags which represent default behaviour of the parser.
1319  //! This is always equal to 0, so that all other flags can be simply ored together.
1320  //! Normally there is no need to inconveniently disable flags by anding with their negated (~) values.
1321  //! This also means that meaning of each flag is a <i>negation</i> of the default setting.
1322  //! For example, if flag name is rapidxml::parse_no_utf8, it means that utf-8 is <i>enabled</i> by default,
1323  //! and using the flag will disable it.
1324  //! <br><br>
1325  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1326  const int parse_default = 0;
1327 
1328  //! A combination of parse flags that forbids any modifications of the source text.
1329  //! This also results in faster parsing. However, note that the following will occur:
1330  //! <ul>
1331  //! <li>names and values of nodes will not be zero terminated, you have to use xml_base::name_size() and xml_base::value_size() functions to determine where name and value ends</li>
1332  //! <li>entities will not be translated</li>
1333  //! <li>whitespace will not be normalized</li>
1334  //! </ul>
1335  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1336  const int parse_non_destructive = parse_no_string_terminators | parse_no_entity_translation;
1337 
1338  //! A combination of parse flags resulting in fastest possible parsing, without sacrificing important data.
1339  //! <br><br>
1340  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1341  const int parse_fastest = parse_non_destructive | parse_no_data_nodes;
1342 
1343  //! A combination of parse flags resulting in largest amount of data being extracted.
1344  //! This usually results in slowest parsing.
1345  //! <br><br>
1346  //! See xml_document::parse() function.
1347  const int parse_full = parse_declaration_node | parse_comment_nodes | parse_doctype_node | parse_pi_nodes | parse_validate_closing_tags;
1348 
1349  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1350  // Internals
1351 
1352  //! \cond internal
1353  namespace internal
1354  {
1355 
1356  // Struct that contains lookup tables for the parser
1357  // It must be a template to allow correct linking (because it has static data members, which are defined in a header file).
1358  template<int Dummy>
1359  struct lookup_tables
1360  {
1361  static const unsigned char lookup_whitespace[256]; // Whitespace table
1362  static const unsigned char lookup_node_name[256]; // Node name table
1363  static const unsigned char lookup_text[256]; // Text table
1364  static const unsigned char lookup_text_pure_no_ws[256]; // Text table
1365  static const unsigned char lookup_text_pure_with_ws[256]; // Text table
1366  static const unsigned char lookup_attribute_name[256]; // Attribute name table
1367  static const unsigned char lookup_attribute_data_1[256]; // Attribute data table with single quote
1368  static const unsigned char lookup_attribute_data_1_pure[256]; // Attribute data table with single quote
1369  static const unsigned char lookup_attribute_data_2[256]; // Attribute data table with double quotes
1370  static const unsigned char lookup_attribute_data_2_pure[256]; // Attribute data table with double quotes
1371  static const unsigned char lookup_digits[256]; // Digits
1372  static const unsigned char lookup_upcase[256]; // To uppercase conversion table for ASCII characters
1373  };
1374 
1375  // Find length of the string
1376  template<class Ch>
1377  inline std::size_t measure(const Ch *p)
1378  {
1379  const Ch *tmp = p;
1380  while (*tmp)
1381  ++tmp;
1382  return tmp - p;
1383  }
1384 
1385  // Compare strings for equality
1386  template<class Ch>
1387  inline bool compare(const Ch *p1, std::size_t size1, const Ch *p2, std::size_t size2, bool case_sensitive)
1388  {
1389  if (size1 != size2)
1390  return false;
1391  if (case_sensitive)
1392  {
1393  for (const Ch *end = p1 + size1; p1 < end; ++p1, ++p2)
1394  if (*p1 != *p2)
1395  return false;
1396  }
1397  else
1398  {
1399  for (const Ch *end = p1 + size1; p1 < end; ++p1, ++p2)
1400  if (lookup_tables<0>::lookup_upcase[static_cast<unsigned char>(*p1)] != lookup_tables<0>::lookup_upcase[static_cast<unsigned char>(*p2)])
1401  return false;
1402  }
1403  return true;
1404  }
1405  }
1406  //! \endcond
1407 
1408  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1409  // Memory pool
1410 
1411  //! This class is used by the parser to create new nodes and attributes, without overheads of dynamic memory allocation.
1412  //! In most cases, you will not need to use this class directly.
1413  //! However, if you need to create nodes manually or modify names/values of nodes,
1414  //! you are encouraged to use memory_pool of relevant xml_document to allocate the memory.
1415  //! Not only is this faster than allocating them by using <code>new</code> operator,
1416  //! but also their lifetime will be tied to the lifetime of document,
1417  //! possibly simplyfing memory management.
1418  //! <br><br>
1419  //! Call allocate_node() or allocate_attribute() functions to obtain new nodes or attributes from the pool.
1420  //! You can also call allocate_string() function to allocate strings.
1421  //! Such strings can then be used as names or values of nodes without worrying about their lifetime.
1422  //! Note that there is no <code>free()</code> function -- all allocations are freed at once when clear() function is called,
1423  //! or when the pool is destroyed.
1424  //! <br><br>
1425  //! It is also possible to create a standalone memory_pool, and use it
1426  //! to allocate nodes, whose lifetime will not be tied to any document.
1427  //! <br><br>
1428  //! Pool maintains <code>RAPIDXML_STATIC_POOL_SIZE</code> bytes of statically allocated memory.
1429  //! Until static memory is exhausted, no dynamic memory allocations are done.
1430  //! When static memory is exhausted, pool allocates additional blocks of memory of size <code>RAPIDXML_DYNAMIC_POOL_SIZE</code> each,
1431  //! by using global <code>new[]</code> and <code>delete[]</code> operators.
1432  //! This behaviour can be changed by setting custom allocation routines.
1433  //! Use set_allocator() function to set them.
1434  //! <br><br>
1435  //! Allocations for nodes, attributes and strings are aligned at <code>RAPIDXML_ALIGNMENT</code> bytes.
1436  //! This value defaults to the size of pointer on target architecture.
1437  //! <br><br>
1438  //! To obtain absolutely top performance from the parser,
1439  //! it is important that all nodes are allocated from a single, contiguous block of memory.
1440  //! Otherwise, cache misses when jumping between two (or more) disjoint blocks of memory can slow down parsing quite considerably.
1441  //! If required, you can tweak <code>RAPIDXML_STATIC_POOL_SIZE</code>, <code>RAPIDXML_DYNAMIC_POOL_SIZE</code> and <code>RAPIDXML_ALIGNMENT</code>
1442  //! to obtain best wasted memory to performance compromise.
1443  //! To do it, define their values before rapidxml.hpp file is included.
1444  //! \param Ch Character type of created nodes.
1445  template<class Ch = char>
1446  class memory_pool
1447  {
1448 
1449  public:
1450 
1451  //! \cond internal
1452  typedef void *(alloc_func)(std::size_t); // Type of user-defined function used to allocate memory
1453  typedef void (free_func)(void *); // Type of user-defined function used to free memory
1454  //! \endcond
1455 
1456  //! Constructs empty pool with default allocator functions.
1457  memory_pool()
1458  : m_alloc_func(0)
1459  , m_free_func(0)
1460  {
1461  init();
1462  }
1463 
1464  //! Destroys pool and frees all the memory.
1465  //! This causes memory occupied by nodes allocated by the pool to be freed.
1466  //! Nodes allocated from the pool are no longer valid.
1467  ~memory_pool()
1468  {
1469  clear();
1470  }
1471 
1472  //! Allocates a new node from the pool, and optionally assigns name and value to it.
1473  //! If the allocation request cannot be accomodated, this function will throw <code>std::bad_alloc</code>.
1474  //! If exceptions are disabled by defining RAPIDXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS, this function
1475  //! will call rapidxml::parse_error_handler() function.
1476  //! \param type Type of node to create.
1477  //! \param name Name to assign to the node, or 0 to assign no name.
1478  //! \param value Value to assign to the node, or 0 to assign no value.
1479  //! \param name_size Size of name to assign, or 0 to automatically calculate size from name string.
1480  //! \param value_size Size of value to assign, or 0 to automatically calculate size from value string.
1481  //! \return Pointer to allocated node. This pointer will never be NULL.
1482  xml_node<Ch> *allocate_node(node_type type,
1483  const Ch *name = 0, const Ch *value = 0,
1484  std::size_t name_size = 0, std::size_t value_size = 0)
1485  {
1486  void *memory = allocate_aligned(sizeof(xml_node<Ch>));
1487  xml_node<Ch> *node = new(memory) xml_node<Ch>(type);
1488  if (name)
1489  {
1490  if (name_size > 0)
1491  node->name(name, name_size);
1492  else
1493  node->name(name);
1494  }
1495  if (value)
1496  {
1497  if (value_size > 0)
1498  node->value(value, value_size);
1499  else
1500  node->value(value);
1501  }
1502  return node;
1503  }
1504 
1505  //! Allocates a new attribute from the pool, and optionally assigns name and value to it.
1506  //! If the allocation request cannot be accomodated, this function will throw <code>std::bad_alloc</code>.
1507  //! If exceptions are disabled by defining RAPIDXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS, this function
1508  //! will call rapidxml::parse_error_handler() function.
1509  //! \param name Name to assign to the attribute, or 0 to assign no name.
1510  //! \param value Value to assign to the attribute, or 0 to assign no value.
1511  //! \param name_size Size of name to assign, or 0 to automatically calculate size from name string.
1512  //! \param value_size Size of value to assign, or 0 to automatically calculate size from value string.
1513  //! \return Pointer to allocated attribute. This pointer will never be NULL.
1514  xml_attribute<Ch> *allocate_attribute(const Ch *name = 0, const Ch *value = 0,
1515  std::size_t name_size = 0, std::size_t value_size = 0)
1516  {
1517  void *memory = allocate_aligned(sizeof(xml_attribute<Ch>));
1518  xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute = new(memory) xml_attribute<Ch>;
1519  if (name)
1520  {
1521  if (name_size > 0)
1522  attribute->name(name, name_size);
1523  else
1524  attribute->name(name);
1525  }
1526  if (value)
1527  {
1528  if (value_size > 0)
1529  attribute->value(value, value_size);
1530  else
1531  attribute->value(value);
1532  }
1533  return attribute;
1534  }
1535 
1536  //! Allocates a char array of given size from the pool, and optionally copies a given string to it.
1537  //! If the allocation request cannot be accomodated, this function will throw <code>std::bad_alloc</code>.
1538  //! If exceptions are disabled by defining RAPIDXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS, this function
1539  //! will call rapidxml::parse_error_handler() function.
1540  //! \param source String to initialize the allocated memory with, or 0 to not initialize it.
1541  //! \param size Number of characters to allocate, or zero to calculate it automatically from source string length; if size is 0, source string must be specified and null terminated.
1542  //! \return Pointer to allocated char array. This pointer will never be NULL.
1543  Ch *allocate_string(const Ch *source = 0, std::size_t size = 0)
1544  {
1545  assert(source || size); // Either source or size (or both) must be specified
1546  if (size == 0)
1547  size = internal::measure(source) + 1;
1548  Ch *result = static_cast<Ch *>(allocate_aligned(size * sizeof(Ch)));
1549  if (source)
1550  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < size; ++i)
1551  result[i] = source[i];
1552  return result;
1553  }
1554 
1555  //! Clones an xml_node and its hierarchy of child nodes and attributes.
1556  //! Nodes and attributes are allocated from this memory pool.
1557  //! Names and values are not cloned, they are shared between the clone and the source.
1558  //! Result node can be optionally specified as a second parameter,
1559  //! in which case its contents will be replaced with cloned source node.
1560  //! This is useful when you want to clone entire document.
1561  //! \param source Node to clone.
1562  //! \param result Node to put results in, or 0 to automatically allocate result node
1563  //! \return Pointer to cloned node. This pointer will never be NULL.
1564  xml_node<Ch> *clone_node(const xml_node<Ch> *source, xml_node<Ch> *result = 0)
1565  {
1566  // Prepare result node
1567  if (result)
1568  {
1569  result->remove_all_attributes();
1570  result->remove_all_nodes();
1571  result->type(source->type());
1572  }
1573  else
1574  result = allocate_node(source->type());
1575 
1576  // Clone name and value
1577  result->name(source->name(), source->name_size());
1578  result->value(source->value(), source->value_size());
1579 
1580  // Clone child nodes and attributes
1581  for (xml_node<Ch> *child = source->first_node(); child; child = child->next_sibling())
1582  result->append_node(clone_node(child));
1583  for (xml_attribute<Ch> *attr = source->first_attribute(); attr; attr = attr->next_attribute())
1584  result->append_attribute(allocate_attribute(attr->name(), attr->value(), attr->name_size(), attr->value_size()));
1585 
1586  return result;
1587  }
1588 
1589  //! Clears the pool.
1590  //! This causes memory occupied by nodes allocated by the pool to be freed.
1591  //! Any nodes or strings allocated from the pool will no longer be valid.
1592  void clear()
1593  {
1594  while (m_begin != m_static_memory)
1595  {
1596  char *previous_begin = reinterpret_cast<header *>(align(m_begin))->previous_begin;
1597  if (m_free_func)
1598  m_free_func(m_begin);
1599  else
1600  delete[] m_begin;
1601  m_begin = previous_begin;
1602  }
1603  init();
1604  }
1605 
1606  //! Sets or resets the user-defined memory allocation functions for the pool.
1607  //! This can only be called when no memory is allocated from the pool yet, otherwise results are undefined.
1608  //! Allocation function must not return invalid pointer on failure. It should either throw,
1609  //! stop the program, or use <code>longjmp()</code> function to pass control to other place of program.
1610  //! If it returns invalid pointer, results are undefined.
1611  //! <br><br>
1612  //! User defined allocation functions must have the following forms:
1613  //! <br><code>
1614  //! <br>void *allocate(std::size_t size);
1615  //! <br>void free(void *pointer);
1616  //! </code><br>
1617  //! \param af Allocation function, or 0 to restore default function
1618  //! \param ff Free function, or 0 to restore default function
1619  void set_allocator(alloc_func *af, free_func *ff)
1620  {
1621  assert(m_begin == m_static_memory && m_ptr == align(m_begin)); // Verify that no memory is allocated yet
1622  m_alloc_func = af;
1623  m_free_func = ff;
1624  }
1625 
1626  private:
1627 
1628  struct header
1629  {
1630  char *previous_begin;
1631  };
1632 
1633  void init()
1634  {
1635  m_begin = m_static_memory;
1636  m_ptr = align(m_begin);
1637  m_end = m_static_memory + sizeof(m_static_memory);
1638  }
1639 
1640  char *align(char *ptr)
1641  {
1642  std::size_t alignment = ((RAPIDXML_ALIGNMENT - (std::size_t(ptr) & (RAPIDXML_ALIGNMENT - 1))) & (RAPIDXML_ALIGNMENT - 1));
1643  return ptr + alignment;
1644  }
1645 
1646  char *allocate_raw(std::size_t size)
1647  {
1648  // Allocate
1649  void *memory;
1650  if (m_alloc_func) // Allocate memory using either user-specified allocation function or global operator new[]
1651  {
1652  memory = m_alloc_func(size);
1653  assert(memory); // Allocator is not allowed to return 0, on failure it must either throw, stop the program or use longjmp
1654  }
1655  else
1656  {
1657  memory = new char[size];
1658 #ifdef RAPIDXML_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1659  if (!memory) // If exceptions are disabled, verify memory allocation, because new will not be able to throw bad_alloc
1660  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("out of memory", 0);
1661 #endif
1662  }
1663  return static_cast<char *>(memory);
1664  }
1665 
1666  void *allocate_aligned(std::size_t size)
1667  {
1668  // Calculate aligned pointer
1669  char *result = align(m_ptr);
1670 
1671  // If not enough memory left in current pool, allocate a new pool
1672  if (result + size > m_end)
1673  {
1674  // Calculate required pool size (may be bigger than RAPIDXML_DYNAMIC_POOL_SIZE)
1675  std::size_t pool_size = RAPIDXML_DYNAMIC_POOL_SIZE;
1676  if (pool_size < size)
1677  pool_size = size;
1678 
1679  // Allocate
1680  std::size_t alloc_size = sizeof(header) + (2 * RAPIDXML_ALIGNMENT - 2) + pool_size; // 2 alignments required in worst case: one for header, one for actual allocation
1681  char *raw_memory = allocate_raw(alloc_size);
1682 
1683  // Setup new pool in allocated memory
1684  char *pool = align(raw_memory);
1685  header *new_header = reinterpret_cast<header *>(pool);
1686  new_header->previous_begin = m_begin;
1687  m_begin = raw_memory;
1688  m_ptr = pool + sizeof(header);
1689  m_end = raw_memory + alloc_size;
1690 
1691  // Calculate aligned pointer again using new pool
1692  result = align(m_ptr);
1693  }
1694 
1695  // Update pool and return aligned pointer
1696  m_ptr = result + size;
1697  return result;
1698  }
1699 
1700  char *m_begin; // Start of raw memory making up current pool
1701  char *m_ptr; // First free byte in current pool
1702  char *m_end; // One past last available byte in current pool
1703  char m_static_memory[RAPIDXML_STATIC_POOL_SIZE]; // Static raw memory
1704  alloc_func *m_alloc_func; // Allocator function, or 0 if default is to be used
1705  free_func *m_free_func; // Free function, or 0 if default is to be used
1706  };
1707 
1708  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1709  // XML base
1710 
1711  //! Base class for xml_node and xml_attribute implementing common functions:
1712  //! name(), name_size(), value(), value_size() and parent().
1713  //! \param Ch Character type to use
1714  template<class Ch = char>
1715  class xml_base
1716  {
1717 
1718  public:
1719 
1720  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1721  // Construction & destruction
1722 
1723  // Construct a base with empty name, value and parent
1724  xml_base()
1725  : m_name(0)
1726  , m_value(0)
1727  , m_parent(0)
1728  {
1729  }
1730 
1731  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1732  // Node data access
1733 
1734  //! Gets name of the node.
1735  //! Interpretation of name depends on type of node.
1736  //! Note that name will not be zero-terminated if rapidxml::parse_no_string_terminators option was selected during parse.
1737  //! <br><br>
1738  //! Use name_size() function to determine length of the name.
1739  //! \return Name of node, or empty string if node has no name.
1740  Ch *name() const
1741  {
1742  return m_name ? m_name : nullstr();
1743  }
1744 
1745  //! Gets size of node name, not including terminator character.
1746  //! This function works correctly irrespective of whether name is or is not zero terminated.
1747  //! \return Size of node name, in characters.
1748  std::size_t name_size() const
1749  {
1750  return m_name ? m_name_size : 0;
1751  }
1752 
1753  //! Gets value of node.
1754  //! Interpretation of value depends on type of node.
1755  //! Note that value will not be zero-terminated if rapidxml::parse_no_string_terminators option was selected during parse.
1756  //! <br><br>
1757  //! Use value_size() function to determine length of the value.
1758  //! \return Value of node, or empty string if node has no value.
1759  Ch *value() const
1760  {
1761  return m_value ? m_value : nullstr();
1762  }
1763 
1764  //! Gets size of node value, not including terminator character.
1765  //! This function works correctly irrespective of whether value is or is not zero terminated.
1766  //! \return Size of node value, in characters.
1767  std::size_t value_size() const
1768  {
1769  return m_value ? m_value_size : 0;
1770  }
1771 
1772  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1773  // Node modification
1774 
1775  //! Sets name of node to a non zero-terminated string.
1776  //! See \ref ownership_of_strings.
1777  //! <br><br>
1778  //! Note that node does not own its name or value, it only stores a pointer to it.
1779  //! It will not delete or otherwise free the pointer on destruction.
1780  //! It is reponsibility of the user to properly manage lifetime of the string.
1781  //! The easiest way to achieve it is to use memory_pool of the document to allocate the string -
1782  //! on destruction of the document the string will be automatically freed.
1783  //! <br><br>
1784  //! Size of name must be specified separately, because name does not have to be zero terminated.
1785  //! Use name(const Ch *) function to have the length automatically calculated (string must be zero terminated).
1786  //! \param name Name of node to set. Does not have to be zero terminated.
1787  //! \param size Size of name, in characters. This does not include zero terminator, if one is present.
1788  void name(const Ch *name, std::size_t size)
1789  {
1790  m_name = const_cast<Ch *>(name);
1791  m_name_size = size;
1792  }
1793 
1794  //! Sets name of node to a zero-terminated string.
1795  //! See also \ref ownership_of_strings and xml_node::name(const Ch *, std::size_t).
1796  //! \param name Name of node to set. Must be zero terminated.
1797  void name(const Ch *name)
1798  {
1799  this->name(name, internal::measure(name));
1800  }
1801 
1802  //! Sets value of node to a non zero-terminated string.
1803  //! See \ref ownership_of_strings.
1804  //! <br><br>
1805  //! Note that node does not own its name or value, it only stores a pointer to it.
1806  //! It will not delete or otherwise free the pointer on destruction.
1807  //! It is reponsibility of the user to properly manage lifetime of the string.
1808  //! The easiest way to achieve it is to use memory_pool of the document to allocate the string -
1809  //! on destruction of the document the string will be automatically freed.
1810  //! <br><br>
1811  //! Size of value must be specified separately, because it does not have to be zero terminated.
1812  //! Use value(const Ch *) function to have the length automatically calculated (string must be zero terminated).
1813  //! <br><br>
1814  //! If an element has a child node of type node_data, it will take precedence over element value when printing.
1815  //! If you want to manipulate data of elements using values, use parser flag rapidxml::parse_no_data_nodes to prevent creation of data nodes by the parser.
1816  //! \param value value of node to set. Does not have to be zero terminated.
1817  //! \param size Size of value, in characters. This does not include zero terminator, if one is present.
1818  void value(const Ch *value, std::size_t size)
1819  {
1820  m_value = const_cast<Ch *>(value);
1821  m_value_size = size;
1822  }
1823 
1824  //! Sets value of node to a zero-terminated string.
1825  //! See also \ref ownership_of_strings and xml_node::value(const Ch *, std::size_t).
1826  //! \param value Vame of node to set. Must be zero terminated.
1827  void value(const Ch *value)
1828  {
1829  this->value(value, internal::measure(value));
1830  }
1831 
1832  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1833  // Related nodes access
1834 
1835  //! Gets node parent.
1836  //! \return Pointer to parent node, or 0 if there is no parent.
1837  xml_node<Ch> *parent() const
1838  {
1839  return m_parent;
1840  }
1841 
1842  protected:
1843 
1844  // Return empty string
1845  static Ch *nullstr()
1846  {
1847  static Ch zero = Ch('\0');
1848  return &zero;
1849  }
1850 
1851  Ch *m_name; // Name of node, or 0 if no name
1852  Ch *m_value; // Value of node, or 0 if no value
1853  std::size_t m_name_size; // Length of node name, or undefined of no name
1854  std::size_t m_value_size; // Length of node value, or undefined if no value
1855  xml_node<Ch> *m_parent; // Pointer to parent node, or 0 if none
1856 
1857  };
1858 
1859  //! Class representing attribute node of XML document.
1860  //! Each attribute has name and value strings, which are available through name() and value() functions (inherited from xml_base).
1861  //! Note that after parse, both name and value of attribute will point to interior of source text used for parsing.
1862  //! Thus, this text must persist in memory for the lifetime of attribute.
1863  //! \param Ch Character type to use.
1864  template<class Ch = char>
1865  class xml_attribute: public xml_base<Ch>
1866  {
1867 
1868  friend class xml_node<Ch>;
1869 
1870  public:
1871 
1872  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1873  // Construction & destruction
1874 
1875  //! Constructs an empty attribute with the specified type.
1876  //! Consider using memory_pool of appropriate xml_document if allocating attributes manually.
1877  xml_attribute()
1878  {
1879  }
1880 
1881  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1882  // Related nodes access
1883 
1884  //! Gets document of which attribute is a child.
1885  //! \return Pointer to document that contains this attribute, or 0 if there is no parent document.
1886  xml_document<Ch> *document() const
1887  {
1888  if (xml_node<Ch> *node = this->parent())
1889  {
1890  while (node->parent())
1891  node = node->parent();
1892  return node->type() == node_document ? static_cast<xml_document<Ch> *>(node) : 0;
1893  }
1894  else
1895  return 0;
1896  }
1897 
1898  //! Gets previous attribute, optionally matching attribute name.
1899  //! \param name Name of attribute to find, or 0 to return previous attribute regardless of its name; this string doesn't have to be zero-terminated if name_size is non-zero
1900  //! \param name_size Size of name, in characters, or 0 to have size calculated automatically from string
1901  //! \param case_sensitive Should name comparison be case-sensitive; non case-sensitive comparison works properly only for ASCII characters
1902  //! \return Pointer to found attribute, or 0 if not found.
1903  xml_attribute<Ch> *previous_attribute(const Ch *name = 0, std::size_t name_size = 0, bool case_sensitive = true) const
1904  {
1905  if (name)
1906  {
1907  if (name_size == 0)
1908  name_size = internal::measure(name);
1909  for (xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute = m_prev_attribute; attribute; attribute = attribute->m_prev_attribute)
1910  if (internal::compare(attribute->name(), attribute->name_size(), name, name_size, case_sensitive))
1911  return attribute;
1912  return 0;
1913  }
1914  else
1915  return this->m_parent ? m_prev_attribute : 0;
1916  }
1917 
1918  //! Gets next attribute, optionally matching attribute name.
1919  //! \param name Name of attribute to find, or 0 to return next attribute regardless of its name; this string doesn't have to be zero-terminated if name_size is non-zero
1920  //! \param name_size Size of name, in characters, or 0 to have size calculated automatically from string
1921  //! \param case_sensitive Should name comparison be case-sensitive; non case-sensitive comparison works properly only for ASCII characters
1922  //! \return Pointer to found attribute, or 0 if not found.
1923  xml_attribute<Ch> *next_attribute(const Ch *name = 0, std::size_t name_size = 0, bool case_sensitive = true) const
1924  {
1925  if (name)
1926  {
1927  if (name_size == 0)
1928  name_size = internal::measure(name);
1929  for (xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute = m_next_attribute; attribute; attribute = attribute->m_next_attribute)
1930  if (internal::compare(attribute->name(), attribute->name_size(), name, name_size, case_sensitive))
1931  return attribute;
1932  return 0;
1933  }
1934  else
1935  return this->m_parent ? m_next_attribute : 0;
1936  }
1937 
1938  private:
1939 
1940  xml_attribute<Ch> *m_prev_attribute; // Pointer to previous sibling of attribute, or 0 if none; only valid if parent is non-zero
1941  xml_attribute<Ch> *m_next_attribute; // Pointer to next sibling of attribute, or 0 if none; only valid if parent is non-zero
1942 
1943  };
1944 
1945  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1946  // XML node
1947 
1948  //! Class representing a node of XML document.
1949  //! Each node may have associated name and value strings, which are available through name() and value() functions.
1950  //! Interpretation of name and value depends on type of the node.
1951  //! Type of node can be determined by using type() function.
1952  //! <br><br>
1953  //! Note that after parse, both name and value of node, if any, will point interior of source text used for parsing.
1954  //! Thus, this text must persist in the memory for the lifetime of node.
1955  //! \param Ch Character type to use.
1956  template<class Ch = char>
1957  class xml_node: public xml_base<Ch>
1958  {
1959 
1960  public:
1961 
1962  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1963  // Construction & destruction
1964 
1965  //! Constructs an empty node with the specified type.
1966  //! Consider using memory_pool of appropriate document to allocate nodes manually.
1967  //! \param type Type of node to construct.
1968  xml_node(node_type type)
1969  : m_type(type)
1970  , m_first_node(0)
1971  , m_first_attribute(0)
1972  {
1973  }
1974 
1975  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1976  // Node data access
1977 
1978  //! Gets type of node.
1979  //! \return Type of node.
1980  node_type type() const
1981  {
1982  return m_type;
1983  }
1984 
1985  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1986  // Related nodes access
1987 
1988  //! Gets document of which node is a child.
1989  //! \return Pointer to document that contains this node, or 0 if there is no parent document.
1990  xml_document<Ch> *document() const
1991  {
1992  xml_node<Ch> *node = const_cast<xml_node<Ch> *>(this);
1993  while (node->parent())
1994  node = node->parent();
1995  return node->type() == node_document ? static_cast<xml_document<Ch> *>(node) : 0;
1996  }
1997 
1998  //! Gets first child node, optionally matching node name.
1999  //! \param name Name of child to find, or 0 to return first child regardless of its name; this string doesn't have to be zero-terminated if name_size is non-zero
2000  //! \param name_size Size of name, in characters, or 0 to have size calculated automatically from string
2001  //! \param case_sensitive Should name comparison be case-sensitive; non case-sensitive comparison works properly only for ASCII characters
2002  //! \return Pointer to found child, or 0 if not found.
2003  xml_node<Ch> *first_node(const Ch *name = 0, std::size_t name_size = 0, bool case_sensitive = true) const
2004  {
2005  if (name)
2006  {
2007  if (name_size == 0)
2008  name_size = internal::measure(name);
2009  for (xml_node<Ch> *child = m_first_node; child; child = child->next_sibling())
2010  if (internal::compare(child->name(), child->name_size(), name, name_size, case_sensitive))
2011  return child;
2012  return 0;
2013  }
2014  else
2015  return m_first_node;
2016  }
2017 
2018  //! Gets last child node, optionally matching node name.
2019  //! Behaviour is undefined if node has no children.
2020  //! Use first_node() to test if node has children.
2021  //! \param name Name of child to find, or 0 to return last child regardless of its name; this string doesn't have to be zero-terminated if name_size is non-zero
2022  //! \param name_size Size of name, in characters, or 0 to have size calculated automatically from string
2023  //! \param case_sensitive Should name comparison be case-sensitive; non case-sensitive comparison works properly only for ASCII characters
2024  //! \return Pointer to found child, or 0 if not found.
2025  xml_node<Ch> *last_node(const Ch *name = 0, std::size_t name_size = 0, bool case_sensitive = true) const
2026  {
2027  assert(m_first_node); // Cannot query for last child if node has no children
2028  if (name)
2029  {
2030  if (name_size == 0)
2031  name_size = internal::measure(name);
2032  for (xml_node<Ch> *child = m_last_node; child; child = child->previous_sibling())
2033  if (internal::compare(child->name(), child->name_size(), name, name_size, case_sensitive))
2034  return child;
2035  return 0;
2036  }
2037  else
2038  return m_last_node;
2039  }
2040 
2041  //! Gets previous sibling node, optionally matching node name.
2042  //! Behaviour is undefined if node has no parent.
2043  //! Use parent() to test if node has a parent.
2044  //! \param name Name of sibling to find, or 0 to return previous sibling regardless of its name; this string doesn't have to be zero-terminated if name_size is non-zero
2045  //! \param name_size Size of name, in characters, or 0 to have size calculated automatically from string
2046  //! \param case_sensitive Should name comparison be case-sensitive; non case-sensitive comparison works properly only for ASCII characters
2047  //! \return Pointer to found sibling, or 0 if not found.
2048  xml_node<Ch> *previous_sibling(const Ch *name = 0, std::size_t name_size = 0, bool case_sensitive = true) const
2049  {
2050  assert(this->m_parent); // Cannot query for siblings if node has no parent
2051  if (name)
2052  {
2053  if (name_size == 0)
2054  name_size = internal::measure(name);
2055  for (xml_node<Ch> *sibling = m_prev_sibling; sibling; sibling = sibling->m_prev_sibling)
2056  if (internal::compare(sibling->name(), sibling->name_size(), name, name_size, case_sensitive))
2057  return sibling;
2058  return 0;
2059  }
2060  else
2061  return m_prev_sibling;
2062  }
2063 
2064  //! Gets next sibling node, optionally matching node name.
2065  //! Behaviour is undefined if node has no parent.
2066  //! Use parent() to test if node has a parent.
2067  //! \param name Name of sibling to find, or 0 to return next sibling regardless of its name; this string doesn't have to be zero-terminated if name_size is non-zero
2068  //! \param name_size Size of name, in characters, or 0 to have size calculated automatically from string
2069  //! \param case_sensitive Should name comparison be case-sensitive; non case-sensitive comparison works properly only for ASCII characters
2070  //! \return Pointer to found sibling, or 0 if not found.
2071  xml_node<Ch> *next_sibling(const Ch *name = 0, std::size_t name_size = 0, bool case_sensitive = true) const
2072  {
2073  assert(this->m_parent); // Cannot query for siblings if node has no parent
2074  if (name)
2075  {
2076  if (name_size == 0)
2077  name_size = internal::measure(name);
2078  for (xml_node<Ch> *sibling = m_next_sibling; sibling; sibling = sibling->m_next_sibling)
2079  if (internal::compare(sibling->name(), sibling->name_size(), name, name_size, case_sensitive))
2080  return sibling;
2081  return 0;
2082  }
2083  else
2084  return m_next_sibling;
2085  }
2086 
2087  //! Gets first attribute of node, optionally matching attribute name.
2088  //! \param name Name of attribute to find, or 0 to return first attribute regardless of its name; this string doesn't have to be zero-terminated if name_size is non-zero
2089  //! \param name_size Size of name, in characters, or 0 to have size calculated automatically from string
2090  //! \param case_sensitive Should name comparison be case-sensitive; non case-sensitive comparison works properly only for ASCII characters
2091  //! \return Pointer to found attribute, or 0 if not found.
2092  xml_attribute<Ch> *first_attribute(const Ch *name = 0, std::size_t name_size = 0, bool case_sensitive = true) const
2093  {
2094  if (name)
2095  {
2096  if (name_size == 0)
2097  name_size = internal::measure(name);
2098  for (xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute = m_first_attribute; attribute; attribute = attribute->m_next_attribute)
2099  if (internal::compare(attribute->name(), attribute->name_size(), name, name_size, case_sensitive))
2100  return attribute;
2101  return 0;
2102  }
2103  else
2104  return m_first_attribute;
2105  }
2106 
2107  //! Gets last attribute of node, optionally matching attribute name.
2108  //! \param name Name of attribute to find, or 0 to return last attribute regardless of its name; this string doesn't have to be zero-terminated if name_size is non-zero
2109  //! \param name_size Size of name, in characters, or 0 to have size calculated automatically from string
2110  //! \param case_sensitive Should name comparison be case-sensitive; non case-sensitive comparison works properly only for ASCII characters
2111  //! \return Pointer to found attribute, or 0 if not found.
2112  xml_attribute<Ch> *last_attribute(const Ch *name = 0, std::size_t name_size = 0, bool case_sensitive = true) const
2113  {
2114  if (name)
2115  {
2116  if (name_size == 0)
2117  name_size = internal::measure(name);
2118  for (xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute = m_last_attribute; attribute; attribute = attribute->m_prev_attribute)
2119  if (internal::compare(attribute->name(), attribute->name_size(), name, name_size, case_sensitive))
2120  return attribute;
2121  return 0;
2122  }
2123  else
2124  return m_first_attribute ? m_last_attribute : 0;
2125  }

2130  //! Sets type of node.
2131  //! \param type Type of node to set.

2133  {
2134  m_type = type;
2135  }

2139 
2140  //! Prepends a new child node.
2141  //! The prepended child becomes the first child, and all existing children are moved one position back.
2142  //! \param child Node to prepend.
2143  void prepend_node(xml_node<Ch> *child)
2144  {
2145  assert(child && !child->parent() && child->type() != node_document);
2146  if (first_node())
2147  {
2148  child->m_next_sibling = m_first_node;
2149  m_first_node->m_prev_sibling = child;
2150  }
2151  else
2152  {
2153  child->m_next_sibling = 0;
2154  m_last_node = child;
2155  }
2156  m_first_node = child;
2157  child->m_parent = this;
2158  child->m_prev_sibling = 0;
2159  }
2160 
2161  //! Appends a new child node.
2162  //! The appended child becomes the last child.
2163  //! \param child Node to append.
2164  void append_node(xml_node<Ch> *child)
2165  {
2166  assert(child && !child->parent() && child->type() != node_document);
2167  if (first_node())
2168  {
2169  child->m_prev_sibling = m_last_node;
2170  m_last_node->m_next_sibling = child;
2171  }
2172  else
2173  {
2174  child->m_prev_sibling = 0;
2175  m_first_node = child;
2176  }
2177  m_last_node = child;
2178  child->m_parent = this;
2179  child->m_next_sibling = 0;
2180  }
2181 
2182  //! Inserts a new child node at specified place inside the node.
2183  //! All children after and including the specified node are moved one position back.
2184  //! \param where Place where to insert the child, or 0 to insert at the back.
2185  //! \param child Node to insert.
2186  void insert_node(xml_node<Ch> *where, xml_node<Ch> *child)
2187  {
2188  assert(!where || where->parent() == this);
2189  assert(child && !child->parent() && child->type() != node_document);
2190  if (where == m_first_node)
2191  prepend_node(child);
2192  else if (where == 0)
2193  append_node(child);
2194  else
2195  {
2196  child->m_prev_sibling = where->m_prev_sibling;
2197  child->m_next_sibling = where;
2198  where->m_prev_sibling->m_next_sibling = child;
2199  where->m_prev_sibling = child;
2200  child->m_parent = this;
2201  }
2202  }
2203 
2204  //! Removes first child node.
2205  //! If node has no children, behaviour is undefined.
2206  //! Use first_node() to test if node has children.
2207  void remove_first_node()
2208  {
2209  assert(first_node());
2210  xml_node<Ch> *child = m_first_node;
2211  m_first_node = child->m_next_sibling;
2212  if (child->m_next_sibling)
2213  child->m_next_sibling->m_prev_sibling = 0;
2214  else
2215  m_last_node = 0;
2216  child->m_parent = 0;
2217  }
2218 
2219  //! Removes last child of the node.
2220  //! If node has no children, behaviour is undefined.
2221  //! Use first_node() to test if node has children.
2222  void remove_last_node()
2223  {
2224  assert(first_node());
2225  xml_node<Ch> *child = m_last_node;
2226  if (child->m_prev_sibling)
2227  {
2228  m_last_node = child->m_prev_sibling;
2229  child->m_prev_sibling->m_next_sibling = 0;
2230  }
2231  else
2232  m_first_node = 0;
2233  child->m_parent = 0;
2234  }
2235 
2236  //! Removes specified child from the node
2237  // \param where Pointer to child to be removed.
2238  void remove_node(xml_node<Ch> *where)
2239  {
2240  assert(where && where->parent() == this);
2241  assert(first_node());
2242  if (where == m_first_node)
2243  remove_first_node();
2244  else if (where == m_last_node)
2245  remove_last_node();
2246  else
2247  {
2248  where->m_prev_sibling->m_next_sibling = where->m_next_sibling;
2249  where->m_next_sibling->m_prev_sibling = where->m_prev_sibling;
2250  where->m_parent = 0;
2251  }
2252  }
2253 
2254  //! Removes all child nodes (but not attributes).
2255  void remove_all_nodes()
2256  {
2257  for (xml_node<Ch> *node = first_node(); node; node = node->m_next_sibling)
2258  node->m_parent = 0;
2259  m_first_node = 0;
2260  }
2261 
2262  //! Prepends a new attribute to the node.
2263  //! \param attribute Attribute to prepend.
2264  void prepend_attribute(xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute)
2265  {
2266  assert(attribute && !attribute->parent());
2267  if (first_attribute())
2268  {
2269  attribute->m_next_attribute = m_first_attribute;
2270  m_first_attribute->m_prev_attribute = attribute;
2271  }
2272  else
2273  {
2274  attribute->m_next_attribute = 0;
2275  m_last_attribute = attribute;
2276  }
2277  m_first_attribute = attribute;
2278  attribute->m_parent = this;
2279  attribute->m_prev_attribute = 0;
2280  }
2281 
2282  //! Appends a new attribute to the node.
2283  //! \param attribute Attribute to append.
2284  void append_attribute(xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute)
2285  {
2286  assert(attribute && !attribute->parent());
2287  if (first_attribute())
2288  {
2289  attribute->m_prev_attribute = m_last_attribute;
2290  m_last_attribute->m_next_attribute = attribute;
2291  }
2292  else
2293  {
2294  attribute->m_prev_attribute = 0;
2295  m_first_attribute = attribute;
2296  }
2297  m_last_attribute = attribute;
2298  attribute->m_parent = this;
2299  attribute->m_next_attribute = 0;
2300  }
2301 
2302  //! Inserts a new attribute at specified place inside the node.
2303  //! All attributes after and including the specified attribute are moved one position back.
2304  //! \param where Place where to insert the attribute, or 0 to insert at the back.
2305  //! \param attribute Attribute to insert.
2306  void insert_attribute(xml_attribute<Ch> *where, xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute)
2307  {
2308  assert(!where || where->parent() == this);
2309  assert(attribute && !attribute->parent());
2310  if (where == m_first_attribute)
2311  prepend_attribute(attribute);
2312  else if (where == 0)
2313  append_attribute(attribute);
2314  else
2315  {
2316  attribute->m_prev_attribute = where->m_prev_attribute;
2317  attribute->m_next_attribute = where;
2318  where->m_prev_attribute->m_next_attribute = attribute;
2319  where->m_prev_attribute = attribute;
2320  attribute->m_parent = this;
2321  }
2322  }
2323 
2324  //! Removes first attribute of the node.
2325  //! If node has no attributes, behaviour is undefined.
2326  //! Use first_attribute() to test if node has attributes.
2327  void remove_first_attribute()
2328  {
2329  assert(first_attribute());
2330  xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute = m_first_attribute;
2331  if (attribute->m_next_attribute)
2332  {
2333  attribute->m_next_attribute->m_prev_attribute = 0;
2334  }
2335  else
2336  m_last_attribute = 0;
2337  attribute->m_parent = 0;
2338  m_first_attribute = attribute->m_next_attribute;
2339  }
2340 
2341  //! Removes last attribute of the node.
2342  //! If node has no attributes, behaviour is undefined.
2343  //! Use first_attribute() to test if node has attributes.
2344  void remove_last_attribute()
2345  {
2346  assert(first_attribute());
2347  xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute = m_last_attribute;
2348  if (attribute->m_prev_attribute)
2349  {
2350  attribute->m_prev_attribute->m_next_attribute = 0;
2351  m_last_attribute = attribute->m_prev_attribute;
2352  }
2353  else
2354  m_first_attribute = 0;
2355  attribute->m_parent = 0;
2356  }
2357 
2358  //! Removes specified attribute from node.
2359  //! \param where Pointer to attribute to be removed.
2360  void remove_attribute(xml_attribute<Ch> *where)
2361  {
2362  assert(first_attribute() && where->parent() == this);
2363  if (where == m_first_attribute)
2364  remove_first_attribute();
2365  else if (where == m_last_attribute)
2366  remove_last_attribute();
2367  else
2368  {
2369  where->m_prev_attribute->m_next_attribute = where->m_next_attribute;
2370  where->m_next_attribute->m_prev_attribute = where->m_prev_attribute;
2371  where->m_parent = 0;
2372  }
2373  }
2374 
2375  //! Removes all attributes of node.
2376  void remove_all_attributes()
2377  {
2378  for (xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute = first_attribute(); attribute; attribute = attribute->m_next_attribute)
2379  attribute->m_parent = 0;
2380  m_first_attribute = 0;
2381  }

2384 
2385  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2386  // Restrictions
2387 
2388  // No copying
2389  xml_node(const xml_node &);
2390  void operator =(const xml_node &);
2391 
2392  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2393  // Data members
2394 
2395  // Note that some of the pointers below have UNDEFINED values if certain other pointers are 0.
2396  // This is required for maximum performance, as it allows the parser to omit initialization of
2397  // unneded/redundant values.
2398  //
2399  // The rules are as follows:
2400  // 1. first_node and first_attribute contain valid pointers, or 0 if node has no children/attributes respectively
2401  // 2. last_node and last_attribute are valid only if node has at least one child/attribute respectively, otherwise they contain garbage
2402  // 3. prev_sibling and next_sibling are valid only if node has a parent, otherwise they contain garbage
2403 
2404  node_type m_type; // Type of node; always valid
2405  xml_node<Ch> *m_first_node; // Pointer to first child node, or 0 if none; always valid
2406  xml_node<Ch> *m_last_node; // Pointer to last child node, or 0 if none; this value is only valid if m_first_node is non-zero
2407  xml_attribute<Ch> *m_first_attribute; // Pointer to first attribute of node, or 0 if none; always valid
2408  xml_attribute<Ch> *m_last_attribute; // Pointer to last attribute of node, or 0 if none; this value is only valid if m_first_attribute is non-zero
2409  xml_node<Ch> *m_prev_sibling; // Pointer to previous sibling of node, or 0 if none; this value is only valid if m_parent is non-zero
2410  xml_node<Ch> *m_next_sibling; // Pointer to next sibling of node, or 0 if none; this value is only valid if m_parent is non-zero
2411 
2412  };
2413 
2414  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2415  // XML document
2416 
2417  //! This class represents root of the DOM hierarchy.
2418  //! It is also an xml_node and a memory_pool through public inheritance.
2419  //! Use parse() function to build a DOM tree from a zero-terminated XML text string.
2420  //! parse() function allocates memory for nodes and attributes by using functions of xml_document,
2421  //! which are inherited from memory_pool.
2422  //! To access root node of the document, use the document itself, as if it was an xml_node.
2423  //! \param Ch Character type to use.
2424  template<class Ch = char>
2425  class xml_document: public xml_node<Ch>, public memory_pool<Ch>
2426  {
2427 
2428  public:
2429 
2430  //! Constructs empty XML document
2431  xml_document()
2432  : xml_node<Ch>(node_document)
2433  {
2434  }
2435 
2436  //! Parses zero-terminated XML string according to given flags.
2437  //! Passed string will be modified by the parser, unless rapidxml::parse_non_destructive flag is used.
2438  //! The string must persist for the lifetime of the document.
2439  //! In case of error, rapidxml::parse_error exception will be thrown.
2440  //! <br><br>
2441  //! If you want to parse contents of a file, you must first load the file into the memory, and pass pointer to its beginning.
2442  //! Make sure that data is zero-terminated.
2443  //! <br><br>
2444  //! Document can be parsed into multiple times.
2445  //! Each new call to parse removes previous nodes and attributes (if any), but does not clear memory pool.
2446  //! \param text XML data to parse; pointer is non-const to denote fact that this data may be modified by the parser.
2447  template<int Flags>
2448  void parse(Ch *text)
2449  {
2450  assert(text);
2451 
2452  // Remove current contents
2453  this->remove_all_nodes();
2454  this->remove_all_attributes();
2455 
2456  // Parse BOM, if any
2457  parse_bom<Flags>(text);
2458 
2459  // Parse children
2460  while (1)
2461  {
2462  // Skip whitespace before node
2463  skip<whitespace_pred, Flags>(text);
2464  if (*text == 0)
2465  break;
2466 
2467  // Parse and append new child
2468  if (*text == Ch('<'))
2469  {
2470  ++text; // Skip '<'
2471  if (xml_node<Ch> *node = parse_node<Flags>(text))
2472  this->append_node(node);
2473  }
2474  else
2475  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected <", text);
2476  }
2477 
2478  }
2479 
2480  //! Clears the document by deleting all nodes and clearing the memory pool.
2481  //! All nodes owned by document pool are destroyed.
2482  void clear()
2483  {
2484  this->remove_all_nodes();
2485  this->remove_all_attributes();
2486  memory_pool<Ch>::clear();
2487  }
2488 
2489  private:
2490 
2491  ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2492  // Internal character utility functions
2493 
2494  // Detect whitespace character
2495  struct whitespace_pred
2496  {
2497  static unsigned char test(Ch ch)
2498  {
2499  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_whitespace[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2500  }
2501  };
2502 
2503  // Detect node name character
2504  struct node_name_pred
2505  {
2506  static unsigned char test(Ch ch)
2507  {
2508  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_node_name[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2509  }
2510  };
2511 
2512  // Detect attribute name character
2513  struct attribute_name_pred
2514  {
2515  static unsigned char test(Ch ch)
2516  {
2517  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_attribute_name[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2518  }
2519  };
2520 
2521  // Detect text character (PCDATA)
2522  struct text_pred
2523  {
2524  static unsigned char test(Ch ch)
2525  {
2526  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_text[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2527  }
2528  };
2529 
2530  // Detect text character (PCDATA) that does not require processing
2531  struct text_pure_no_ws_pred
2532  {

2534  {
2535  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_text_pure_no_ws[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2536  }
2537  };
2538 
2539  // Detect text character (PCDATA) that does not require processing
2540  struct text_pure_with_ws_pred
2541  {
2542  static unsigned char test(Ch ch)
2543  {
2544  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_text_pure_with_ws[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2545  }
2546  };
2547 
2548  // Detect attribute value character
2549  template<Ch Quote>
2550  struct attribute_value_pred
2551  {
2552  static unsigned char test(Ch ch)
2553  {
2554  if (Quote == Ch('\''))
2555  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_attribute_data_1[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2556  if (Quote == Ch('\"'))
2557  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_attribute_data_2[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2558  return 0; // Should never be executed, to avoid warnings on Comeau
2559  }
2560  };
2561 
2562  // Detect attribute value character
2563  template<Ch Quote>
2564  struct attribute_value_pure_pred
2565  {
2566  static unsigned char test(Ch ch)
2567  {
2568  if (Quote == Ch('\''))
2569  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_attribute_data_1_pure[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2570  if (Quote == Ch('\"'))
2571  return internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_attribute_data_2_pure[static_cast<unsigned char>(ch)];
2572  return 0; // Should never be executed, to avoid warnings on Comeau
2573  }
2574  };
2575 
2576  // Insert coded character, using UTF8 or 8-bit ASCII
2577  template<int Flags>
2578  static void insert_coded_character(Ch *&text, unsigned long code)
2579  {
2580  if (Flags & parse_no_utf8)
2581  {
2582  // Insert 8-bit ASCII character
2583  // Todo: possibly verify that code is less than 256 and use replacement char otherwise?
2584  text[0] = static_cast<unsigned char>(code);
2585  text += 1;
2586  }
2587  else
2588  {
2589  // Insert UTF8 sequence
2590  if (code < 0x80) // 1 byte sequence
2591  {
2592  text[0] = static_cast<unsigned char>(code);
2593  text += 1;
2594  }
2595  else if (code < 0x800) // 2 byte sequence
2596  {
2597  text[1] = static_cast<unsigned char>((code | 0x80) & 0xBF); code >>= 6;
2598  text[0] = static_cast<unsigned char>(code | 0xC0);
2599  text += 2;
2600  }
2601  else if (code < 0x10000) // 3 byte sequence
2602  {
2603  text[2] = static_cast<unsigned char>((code | 0x80) & 0xBF); code >>= 6;
2604  text[1] = static_cast<unsigned char>((code | 0x80) & 0xBF); code >>= 6;
2605  text[0] = static_cast<unsigned char>(code | 0xE0);
2606  text += 3;
2607  }
2608  else if (code < 0x110000) // 4 byte sequence
2609  {
2610  text[3] = static_cast<unsigned char>((code | 0x80) & 0xBF); code >>= 6;
2611  text[2] = static_cast<unsigned char>((code | 0x80) & 0xBF); code >>= 6;
2612  text[1] = static_cast<unsigned char>((code | 0x80) & 0xBF); code >>= 6;
2613  text[0] = static_cast<unsigned char>(code | 0xF0);
2614  text += 4;
2615  }
2616  else // Invalid, only codes up to 0x10FFFF are allowed in Unicode
2617  {
2618  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("invalid numeric character entity", text);
2619  }
2620  }
2621  }
2622 
2623  // Skip characters until predicate evaluates to true
2624  template<class StopPred, int Flags>
2625  static void skip(Ch *&text)
2626  {
2627  Ch *tmp = text;
2628  while (StopPred::test(*tmp))
2629  ++tmp;
2630  text = tmp;
2631  }
2632 
2633  // Skip characters until predicate evaluates to true while doing the following:
2634  // - replacing XML character entity references with proper characters (&apos; &amp; &quot; &lt; &gt; &#...;)
2635  // - condensing whitespace sequences to single space character
2636  template<class StopPred, class StopPredPure, int Flags>
2637  static Ch *skip_and_expand_character_refs(Ch *&text)
2638  {
2639  // If entity translation, whitespace condense and whitespace trimming is disabled, use plain skip
2640  if (Flags & parse_no_entity_translation &&
2641  !(Flags & parse_normalize_whitespace) &&
2642  !(Flags & parse_trim_whitespace))
2643  {
2644  skip<StopPred, Flags>(text);
2645  return text;
2646  }
2647 
2648  // Use simple skip until first modification is detected
2649  skip<StopPredPure, Flags>(text);
2650 
2651  // Use translation skip
2652  Ch *src = text;
2653  Ch *dest = src;
2654  while (StopPred::test(*src))
2655  {
2656  // If entity translation is enabled
2657  if (!(Flags & parse_no_entity_translation))
2658  {
2659  // Test if replacement is needed
2660  if (src[0] == Ch('&'))
2661  {
2662  switch (src[1])
2663  {
2664 
2665  // &amp; &apos;
2666  case Ch('a'):
2667  if (src[2] == Ch('m') && src[3] == Ch('p') && src[4] == Ch(';'))
2668  {
2669  *dest = Ch('&');
2670  ++dest;
2671  src += 5;
2672  continue;
2673  }
2674  if (src[2] == Ch('p') && src[3] == Ch('o') && src[4] == Ch('s') && src[5] == Ch(';'))
2675  {
2676  *dest = Ch('\'');
2677  ++dest;
2678  src += 6;
2679  continue;
2680  }
2681  break;
2682 
2683  // &quot;
2684  case Ch('q'):
2685  if (src[2] == Ch('u') && src[3] == Ch('o') && src[4] == Ch('t') && src[5] == Ch(';'))
2686  {
2687  *dest = Ch('"');
2688  ++dest;
2689  src += 6;
2690  continue;
2691  }
2692  break;
2693 
2694  // &gt;
2695  case Ch('g'):
2696  if (src[2] == Ch('t') && src[3] == Ch(';'))
2697  {
2698  *dest = Ch('>');
2699  ++dest;
2700  src += 4;
2701  continue;
2702  }
2703  break;
2704 
2705  // &lt;
2706  case Ch('l'):
2707  if (src[2] == Ch('t') && src[3] == Ch(';'))
2708  {
2709  *dest = Ch('<');
2710  ++dest;
2711  src += 4;
2712  continue;
2713  }
2714  break;
2715 
2716  // &#...; - assumes ASCII
2717  case Ch('#'):
2718  if (src[2] == Ch('x'))
2719  {
2720  unsigned long code = 0;
2721  src += 3; // Skip &#x
2722  while (1)
2723  {
2724  unsigned char digit = internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_digits[static_cast<unsigned char>(*src)];
2725  if (digit == 0xFF)
2726  break;
2727  code = code * 16 + digit;
2728  ++src;
2729  }
2730  insert_coded_character<Flags>(dest, code); // Put character in output
2731  }
2732  else
2733  {
2734  unsigned long code = 0;
2735  src += 2; // Skip &#
2736  while (1)
2737  {
2738  unsigned char digit = internal::lookup_tables<0>::lookup_digits[static_cast<unsigned char>(*src)];
2739  if (digit == 0xFF)
2740  break;
2741  code = code * 10 + digit;
2742  ++src;
2743  }
2744  insert_coded_character<Flags>(dest, code); // Put character in output
2745  }
2746  if (*src == Ch(';'))
2747  ++src;
2748  else
2749  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected ;", src);
2750  continue;
2751 
2752  // Something else
2753  default:
2754  // Ignore, just copy '&' verbatim
2755  break;
2756 
2757  }
2758  }
2759  }
2760 
2761  // If whitespace condensing is enabled
2762  if (Flags & parse_normalize_whitespace)
2763  {
2764  // Test if condensing is needed
2765  if (whitespace_pred::test(*src))
2766  {
2767  *dest = Ch(' '); ++dest; // Put single space in dest
2768  ++src; // Skip first whitespace char
2769  // Skip remaining whitespace chars
2770  while (whitespace_pred::test(*src))
2771  ++src;
2772  continue;
2773  }
2774  }
2775 
2776  // No replacement, only copy character
2777  *dest++ = *src++;
2778 
2779  }
2780 
2781  // Return new end
2782  text = src;
2783  return dest;
2784 
2785  }
2786
