2790  // Parse BOM, if any
2791  template<int Flags>
2792  void parse_bom(Ch *&text)
2793  {
2794  // UTF-8?
2795  if (static_cast<unsigned char>(text[0]) == 0xEF &&
2796  static_cast<unsigned char>(text[1]) == 0xBB &&
2797  static_cast<unsigned char>(text[2]) == 0xBF)
2798  {
2799  text += 3; // Skup utf-8 bom
2800  }
2801  }
2802 
2803  // Parse XML declaration (<?xml...)
2804  template<int Flags>
2805  xml_node<Ch> *parse_xml_declaration(Ch *&text)
2806  {
2807  // If parsing of declaration is disabled
2808  if (!(Flags & parse_declaration_node))
2809  {
2810  // Skip until end of declaration
2811  while (text[0] != Ch('?') || text[1] != Ch('>'))
2812  {
2813  if (!text[0])
2814  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
2815  ++text;
2816  }
2817  text += 2; // Skip '?>'
2818  return 0;
2819  }
2820 
2821  // Create declaration
2822  xml_node<Ch> *declaration = this->allocate_node(node_declaration);
2823 
2824  // Skip whitespace before attributes or ?>
2825  skip<whitespace_pred, Flags>(text);
2826 
2827  // Parse declaration attributes
2828  parse_node_attributes<Flags>(text, declaration);
2829 
2830  // Skip ?>
2831  if (text[0] != Ch('?') || text[1] != Ch('>'))
2832  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected ?>", text);
2833  text += 2;
2834 
2835  return declaration;

2838  // Parse XML comment (<!--...)

2840  xml_node<Ch> *parse_comment(Ch *&text)
2841  {

2843  if (!(Flags & parse_comment_nodes))
2844  {
2845  // Skip until end of comment
2846  while (text[0] != Ch('-') || text[1] != Ch('-') || text[2] != Ch('>'))
2847  {
2848  if (!text[0])
2849  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
2850  ++text;
2851  }
2852  text += 3; // Skip '-->'
2853  return 0; // Do not produce comment node
2854  }

2857  Ch *value = text;
2858 
2859  // Skip until end of comment
2860  while (text[0] != Ch('-') || text[1] != Ch('-') || text[2] != Ch('>'))

2879  // Parse DOCTYPE
2880  template<int Flags>
2881  xml_node<Ch> *parse_doctype(Ch *&text)
2882  {
2883  // Remember value start
2884  Ch *value = text;
2885 
2886  // Skip to >
2887  while (*text != Ch('>'))
2888  {
2889  // Determine character type
2890  switch (*text)
2891  {
2892 
2893  // If '[' encountered, scan for matching ending ']' using naive algorithm with depth
2894  // This works for all W3C test files except for 2 most wicked
2895  case Ch('['):
2896  {
2897  ++text; // Skip '['
2898  int depth = 1;
2899  while (depth > 0)
2900  {
2901  switch (*text)
2902  {
2903  case Ch('['): ++depth; break;
2904  case Ch(']'): --depth; break;
2905  case 0: RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
2906  }
2907  ++text;
2908  }
2909  break;
2910  }
2911 
2912  // Error on end of text
2913  case Ch('\0'):
2914  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
2915 
2916  // Other character, skip it
2917  default:
2918  ++text;
2919 
2920  }
2921  }
2922 
2923  // If DOCTYPE nodes enabled
2924  if (Flags & parse_doctype_node)
2925  {
2926  // Create a new doctype node
2927  xml_node<Ch> *doctype = this->allocate_node(node_doctype);
2928  doctype->value(value, text - value);
2929 
2930  // Place zero terminator after value
2931  if (!(Flags & parse_no_string_terminators))
2932  *text = Ch('\0');
2933 
2934  text += 1; // skip '>'
2935  return doctype;
2936  }
2937  else
2938  {
2939  text += 1; // skip '>'
2940  return 0;
2941  }
2942 
2943  }
2944 
2945  // Parse PI
2946  template<int Flags>
2947  xml_node<Ch> *parse_pi(Ch *&text)
2948  {
2949  // If creation of PI nodes is enabled
2950  if (Flags & parse_pi_nodes)
2951  {
2952  // Create pi node
2953  xml_node<Ch> *pi = this->allocate_node(node_pi);
2954 
2955  // Extract PI target name
2956  Ch *name = text;
2957  skip<node_name_pred, Flags>(text);
2958  if (text == name)
2959  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected PI target", text);
2960  pi->name(name, text - name);
2961 
2962  // Skip whitespace between pi target and pi
2963  skip<whitespace_pred, Flags>(text);
2964 
2965  // Remember start of pi
2966  Ch *value = text;
2967 
2968  // Skip to '?>'
2969  while (text[0] != Ch('?') || text[1] != Ch('>'))
2970  {
2971  if (*text == Ch('\0'))
2972  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
2973  ++text;
2974  }
2975 
2976  // Set pi value (verbatim, no entity expansion or whitespace normalization)
2977  pi->value(value, text - value);
2978 
2979  // Place zero terminator after name and value
2980  if (!(Flags & parse_no_string_terminators))
2981  {
2982  pi->name()[pi->name_size()] = Ch('\0');
2983  pi->value()[pi->value_size()] = Ch('\0');
2984  }
2985 
2986  text += 2; // Skip '?>'
2987  return pi;
2988  }
2989  else
2990  {
2991  // Skip to '?>'
2992  while (text[0] != Ch('?') || text[1] != Ch('>'))
2993  {
2994  if (*text == Ch('\0'))
2995  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
2996  ++text;
2997  }
2998  text += 2; // Skip '?>'
2999  return 0;
3000  }
3001  }
3002 
3003  // Parse and append data
3004  // Return character that ends data.
3005  // This is necessary because this character might have been overwritten by a terminating 0
3006  template<int Flags>
3007  Ch parse_and_append_data(xml_node<Ch> *node, Ch *&text, Ch *contents_start)
3008  {
3009  // Backup to contents start if whitespace trimming is disabled
3010  if (!(Flags & parse_trim_whitespace))
3011  text = contents_start;
3012 
3013  // Skip until end of data
3014  Ch *value = text, *end;
3015  if (Flags & parse_normalize_whitespace)
3016  end = skip_and_expand_character_refs<text_pred, text_pure_with_ws_pred, Flags>(text);
3017  else
3018  end = skip_and_expand_character_refs<text_pred, text_pure_no_ws_pred, Flags>(text);
3019 
3020  // Trim trailing whitespace if flag is set; leading was already trimmed by whitespace skip after >
3021  if (Flags & parse_trim_whitespace)
3022  {
3023  if (Flags & parse_normalize_whitespace)
3024  {
3025  // Whitespace is already condensed to single space characters by skipping function, so just trim 1 char off the end
3026  if (*(end - 1) == Ch(' '))
3027  --end;
3028  }
3029  else
3030  {
3031  // Backup until non-whitespace character is found
3032  while (whitespace_pred::test(*(end - 1)))
3033  --end;
3034  }
3035  }
3036 
3037  // If characters are still left between end and value (this test is only necessary if normalization is enabled)
3038  // Create new data node
3039  if (!(Flags & parse_no_data_nodes))
3040  {
3041  xml_node<Ch> *data = this->allocate_node(node_data);
3042  data->value(value, end - value);
3043  node->append_node(data);
3044  }
3045 
3046  // Add data to parent node if no data exists yet
3047  if (!(Flags & parse_no_element_values))
3048  if (*node->value() == Ch('\0'))
3049  node->value(value, end - value);
3050 
3051  // Place zero terminator after value
3052  if (!(Flags & parse_no_string_terminators))
3053  {
3054  Ch ch = *text;
3055  *end = Ch('\0');
3056  return ch; // Return character that ends data; this is required because zero terminator overwritten it
3057  }
3058 
3059  // Return character that ends data
3060  return *text;
3061  }
3062 
3063  // Parse CDATA
3064  template<int Flags>
3065  xml_node<Ch> *parse_cdata(Ch *&text)
3066  {
3067  // If CDATA is disabled
3068  if (Flags & parse_no_data_nodes)
3069  {
3070  // Skip until end of cdata
3071  while (text[0] != Ch(']') || text[1] != Ch(']') || text[2] != Ch('>'))
3072  {
3073  if (!text[0])
3074  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
3075  ++text;
3076  }
3077  text += 3; // Skip ]]>
3078  return 0; // Do not produce CDATA node
3079  }
3080 
3081  // Skip until end of cdata
3082  Ch *value = text;
3083  while (text[0] != Ch(']') || text[1] != Ch(']') || text[2] != Ch('>'))
3084  {
3085  if (!text[0])
3086  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
3087  ++text;
3088  }
3089 
3090  // Create new cdata node
3091  xml_node<Ch> *cdata = this->allocate_node(node_cdata);
3092  cdata->value(value, text - value);
3093

3101 
3102  // Parse element node
3103  template<int Flags>
3104  xml_node<Ch> *parse_element(Ch *&text)
3105  {
3106  // Create element node
3107  xml_node<Ch> *element = this->allocate_node(node_element);
3108 
3109  // Extract element name
3110  Ch *name = text;
3111  skip<node_name_pred, Flags>(text);
3112  if (text == name)
3113  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected element name", text);
3114  element->name(name, text - name);
3115 
3116  // Skip whitespace between element name and attributes or >
3117  skip<whitespace_pred, Flags>(text);
3118 
3119  // Parse attributes, if any
3120  parse_node_attributes<Flags>(text, element);
3121 
3122  // Determine ending type
3123  if (*text == Ch('>'))
3124  {
3125  ++text;
3126  parse_node_contents<Flags>(text, element);
3127  }
3128  else if (*text == Ch('/'))
3129  {
3130  ++text;
3131  if (*text != Ch('>'))
3132  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected >", text);
3133  ++text;
3134  }
3135  else
3136  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected >", text);
3137 
3138  // Place zero terminator after name
3139  if (!(Flags & parse_no_string_terminators))
3140  element->name()[element->name_size()] = Ch('\0');
3141 
3142  // Return parsed element
3143  return element;
3144  }
3145 
3146  // Determine node type, and parse it
3147  template<int Flags>
3148  xml_node<Ch> *parse_node(Ch *&text)
3149  {
3150  // Parse proper node type
3151  switch (text[0])
3152  {
3153 
3154  // <...
3155  default:
3156  // Parse and append element node
3157  return parse_element<Flags>(text);
3158 
3159  // <?...
3160  case Ch('?'):
3161  ++text; // Skip ?
3162  if ((text[0] == Ch('x') || text[0] == Ch('X')) &&
3163  (text[1] == Ch('m') || text[1] == Ch('M')) &&
3164  (text[2] == Ch('l') || text[2] == Ch('L')) &&
3165  whitespace_pred::test(text[3]))
3166  {
3167  // '<?xml ' - xml declaration
3168  text += 4; // Skip 'xml '
3169  return parse_xml_declaration<Flags>(text);
3170  }
3171  else
3172  {
3173  // Parse PI
3174  return parse_pi<Flags>(text);
3175  }
3176 
3177  // <!...
3178  case Ch('!'):
3179 
3180  // Parse proper subset of <! node
3181  switch (text[1])
3182  {
3183 
3184  // <!-
3185  case Ch('-'):
3186  if (text[2] == Ch('-'))
3187  {
3188  // '<!--' - xml comment
3189  text += 3; // Skip '!--'
3190  return parse_comment<Flags>(text);
3191  }
3192  break;
3193 
3194  // <![
3195  case Ch('['):
3196  if (text[2] == Ch('C') && text[3] == Ch('D') && text[4] == Ch('A') &&
3197  text[5] == Ch('T') && text[6] == Ch('A') && text[7] == Ch('['))
3198  {
3199  // '<![CDATA[' - cdata
3200  text += 8; // Skip '![CDATA['
3201  return parse_cdata<Flags>(text);
3202  }
3203  break;
3204 
3205  // <!D
3206  case Ch('D'):
3207  if (text[2] == Ch('O') && text[3] == Ch('C') && text[4] == Ch('T') &&
3208  text[5] == Ch('Y') && text[6] == Ch('P') && text[7] == Ch('E') &&
3209  whitespace_pred::test(text[8]))
3210  {
3211  // '<!DOCTYPE ' - doctype
3212  text += 9; // skip '!DOCTYPE '
3213  return parse_doctype<Flags>(text);
3214  }
3215 
3216  } // switch
3217 
3218  // Attempt to skip other, unrecognized node types starting with <!
3219  ++text; // Skip !
3220  while (*text != Ch('>'))
3221  {
3222  if (*text == 0)
3223  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
3224  ++text;
3225  }
3226  ++text; // Skip '>'
3227  return 0; // No node recognized
3228 
3229  }
3230  }
3231 
3232  // Parse contents of the node - children, data etc.
3233  template<int Flags>
3234  void parse_node_contents(Ch *&text, xml_node<Ch> *node)
3235  {
3236  // For all children and text
3237  while (1)
3238  {
3239  // Skip whitespace between > and node contents
3240  Ch *contents_start = text; // Store start of node contents before whitespace is skipped
3241  skip<whitespace_pred, Flags>(text);
3242  Ch next_char = *text;
3243 
3244  // After data nodes, instead of continuing the loop, control jumps here.
3245  // This is because zero termination inside parse_and_append_data() function
3246  // would wreak havoc with the above code.
3247  // Also, skipping whitespace after data nodes is unnecessary.
3248  after_data_node:
3249 
3250  // Determine what comes next: node closing, child node, data node, or 0?
3251  switch (next_char)
3252  {
3253 
3254  // Node closing or child node
3255  case Ch('<'):
3256  if (text[1] == Ch('/'))
3257  {
3258  // Node closing
3259  text += 2; // Skip '</'
3260  if (Flags & parse_validate_closing_tags)
3261  {
3262  // Skip and validate closing tag name
3263  Ch *closing_name = text;
3264  skip<node_name_pred, Flags>(text);
3265  if (!internal::compare(node->name(), node->name_size(), closing_name, text - closing_name, true))
3266  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("invalid closing tag name", text);
3267  }
3268  else
3269  {
3270  // No validation, just skip name
3271  skip<node_name_pred, Flags>(text);
3272  }
3273  // Skip remaining whitespace after node name
3274  skip<whitespace_pred, Flags>(text);
3275  if (*text != Ch('>'))
3276  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected >", text);
3277  ++text; // Skip '>'
3278  return; // Node closed, finished parsing contents
3279  }
3280  else
3281  {
3282  // Child node
3283  ++text; // Skip '<'
3284  if (xml_node<Ch> *child = parse_node<Flags>(text))
3285  node->append_node(child);
3286  }
3287  break;
3288 
3289  // End of data - error
3290  case Ch('\0'):
3291  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("unexpected end of data", text);
3292 
3293  // Data node
3294  default:
3295  next_char = parse_and_append_data<Flags>(node, text, contents_start);
3296  goto after_data_node; // Bypass regular processing after data nodes
3297 
3298  }
3299  }
3300  }
3301 
3302  // Parse XML attributes of the node
3303  template<int Flags>
3304  void parse_node_attributes(Ch *&text, xml_node<Ch> *node)
3305  {
3306  // For all attributes
3307  while (attribute_name_pred::test(*text))
3308  {
3309  // Extract attribute name
3310  Ch *name = text;
3311  ++text; // Skip first character of attribute name
3312  skip<attribute_name_pred, Flags>(text);
3313  if (text == name)
3314  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected attribute name", name);
3315 
3316  // Create new attribute
3317  xml_attribute<Ch> *attribute = this->allocate_attribute();
3318  attribute->name(name, text - name);
3319  node->append_attribute(attribute);
3320 
3321  // Skip whitespace after attribute name
3322  skip<whitespace_pred, Flags>(text);
3323 
3324  // Skip =
3325  if (*text != Ch('='))
3326  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected =", text);
3327  ++text;
3328 
3329  // Add terminating zero after name
3330  if (!(Flags & parse_no_string_terminators))
3331  attribute->name()[attribute->name_size()] = 0;
3332 
3333  // Skip whitespace after =
3334  skip<whitespace_pred, Flags>(text);
3335 
3336  // Skip quote and remember if it was ' or "
3337  Ch quote = *text;
3338  if (quote != Ch('\'') && quote != Ch('"'))
3339  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected ' or \"", text);
3340  ++text;
3341 
3342  // Extract attribute value and expand char refs in it
3343  Ch *value = text, *end;
3344  const int AttFlags = Flags & ~parse_normalize_whitespace; // No whitespace normalization in attributes
3345  if (quote == Ch('\''))
3346  end = skip_and_expand_character_refs<attribute_value_pred<Ch('\'')>, attribute_value_pure_pred<Ch('\'')>, AttFlags>(text);
3347  else
3348  end = skip_and_expand_character_refs<attribute_value_pred<Ch('"')>, attribute_value_pure_pred<Ch('"')>, AttFlags>(text);
3349 
3350  // Set attribute value
3351  attribute->value(value, end - value);
3352 
3353  // Make sure that end quote is present
3354  if (*text != quote)
3355  RAPIDXML_PARSE_ERROR("expected ' or \"", text);
3356  ++text; // Skip quote
3357 
3358  // Add terminating zero after value
3359  if (!(Flags & parse_no_string_terminators))
3360  attribute->value()[attribute->value_size()] = 0;
3361 
3362  // Skip whitespace after attribute value
3363  skip<whitespace_pred, Flags>(text);
3364  }
3365  }
3366 
3367  };

3369  //! \cond internal
3370  namespace internal
3371  {

3707 #pragma once
3708 
3709 #define ROTLEFT(a,b) (((a) << (b)) | ((a) >> (32-(b))))
3710 #define ROTRIGHT(a,b) (((a) >> (b)) | ((a) << (32-(b))))
3711 
3712 // SHA256.
3713 #define CH(x,y,z) (((x) & (y)) ^ (~(x) & (z)))
3714 #define MAJ(x,y,z) (((x) & (y)) ^ ((x) & (z)) ^ ((y) & (z)))
3715 #define EP0(x) (ROTRIGHT(x,2) ^ ROTRIGHT(x,13) ^ ROTRIGHT(x,22))
3716 #define EP1(x) (ROTRIGHT(x,6) ^ ROTRIGHT(x,11) ^ ROTRIGHT(x,25))
3717 #define SIG0(x) (ROTRIGHT(x,7) ^ ROTRIGHT(x,18) ^ ((x) >> 3))
3718 #define SIG1(x) (ROTRIGHT(x,17) ^ ROTRIGHT(x,19) ^ ((x) >> 10))
3719 
3720 // MD5.
3721 #define F(x,y,z) ((x & y) | (~x & z))
3722 #define G(x,y,z) ((x & z) | (y & ~z))
3723 #define H(x,y,z) (x ^ y ^ z)
3724 #define I(x,y,z) (y ^ (x | ~z))
3725 
3726 #define FF(a,b,c,d,m,s,t) { a += F(b,c,d) + m + t; \
3727  a = b + ROTLEFT(a,s); }
3728 #define GG(a,b,c,d,m,s,t) { a += G(b,c,d) + m + t; \
3729  a = b + ROTLEFT(a,s); }
3730 #define HH(a,b,c,d,m,s,t) { a += H(b,c,d) + m + t; \
3731  a = b + ROTLEFT(a,s); }
3732 #define II(a,b,c,d,m,s,t) { a += I(b,c,d) + m + t; \
3733  a = b + ROTLEFT(a,s); }
3734

3910  * character `/`, if any instances exist aside from possibly the delimiter
3911  * `://`. If there are no other instances of `/`, then @p fullPath itself
3912  * will be returned.
3913  *
3914  * If @p fullPath ends with a trailing `/` or a glob indication (i.e. is a
3915  * directory), these trailing characters will be stripped prior to the
3916  * logic above, thus the innermost directory in the full path will be
3917  * returned.
3918  */
3919  ARBITER_DLL std::string getBasename(std::string fullPath);

3922  * For file paths, this corresponds to the directory path above the file.
3923  * For directory paths, this corresponds to all directories above the
3924  * innermost directory.
3925  */
3926  ARBITER_DLL std::string getNonBasename(std::string fullPath);

3928  /** @cond arbiter_internal */
3929  ARBITER_DLL inline bool isSlash(char c) { return c == '/' || c == '\\'; }
3930 
3931  /** Returns true if the last character is an asterisk. */
3932  ARBITER_DLL inline bool isGlob(std::string path)
3933  {
3934  return path.size() && path.back() == '*';
3935  }
3936 
3937  /** Returns true if the last character is a slash or an asterisk. */
3938  inline bool isDirectory(std::string path)
3939  {
3940  return (path.size() && isSlash(path.back())) || isGlob(path);
3941  }
3942 
3943  inline std::string joinImpl(bool first = false) { return std::string(); }
3944 
3945  template <typename ...Paths>
3946  inline std::string joinImpl(
3947  bool first,
3948  std::string current,
3949  Paths&&... paths)
3950  {
3951  const bool currentIsDir(current.size() && isSlash(current.back()));
3952  std::string next(joinImpl(false, std::forward<Paths>(paths)...));
3953 
3954  // Strip slashes from the front of our remainder.
3955  while (next.size() && isSlash(next.front())) next = next.substr(1);
3956 
3957  if (first)
3958  {
3959  // If this is the first component, strip a single trailing slash if
3960  // one exists - but do not strip a double trailing slash since we
3961  // want to retain Windows paths like "C://".
3962  if (
3963  current.size() > 1 &&
3964  isSlash(current.back()) &&
3965  !isSlash(current.at(current.size() - 2)))
3966  {
3967  current.pop_back();
3968  }
3969  }
3970  else
3971  {
3972  while (current.size() && isSlash(current.back()))
3973  {
3974  current.pop_back();
3975  }
3976  if (current.empty()) return next;
3977  }
3978 
3979  std::string sep;
3980 
3981  if (next.size() && (current.empty() || !isSlash(current.back())))
3982  {
3983  // We are going to join current with a populated subpath, so make
3984  // sure they are separated by a slash.
3985  sep = "/";
3986  }
3987  else if (next.empty() && currentIsDir)
3988  {
3989  // We are at the end of the chain, and the last component was a
3990  // directory. Retain its trailing slash.
3991  if (current.size() && !isSlash(current.back()))
3992  {
3993  sep = "/";
3994  }
3995  }
3996 
3997  return current + sep + next;
3998  }
3999  /** @endcond */
4000 
4001  /** @brief Join one or more path components "intelligently".
4002  *
4003  * The result is the concatenation of @p path and any members of @p paths
4004  * with exactly one slash preceding each non-empty portion of @p path or
4005  * @p paths. Portions of @p paths will be stripped of leading slashes prior
4006  * to processing, so portions containing only slashes are considered empty.
4007  *
4008  * If @p path contains a single trailing slash preceded by a non-slash
4009  * character, then that slash will be stripped prior to processing.
4010  *
4011  * @code
4012  * join("") // ""
4013  * join("/") // "/"
4014  * join("/var", "log", "arbiter.log") // "/var/log/arbiter.log"
4015  * join("/var/", "log", "arbiter.log") // "/var/log/arbiter.log"
4016  * join("", "var", "log", "arbiter.log") // "/var/log/arbiter.log"
4017  * join("/", "/var", "log", "arbiter.log") // "/var/log/arbiter.log"
4018  * join("", "/var", "log", "arbiter.log") // "/var/log/arbiter.log"
4019  * join("~", "code", "", "test.cpp", "/") // "~/code/test.cpp"
4020  * join("C:\\", "My Documents") // "C:/My Documents"
4021  * join("s3://", "bucket", "object.txt") // "s3://bucket/object.txt"
4022  * @endcode
4023  */
4024  template <typename ...Paths>
4025  inline std::string join(std::string path, Paths&&... paths)
4026  {
4027  return joinImpl(true, path, std::forward<Paths>(paths)...);
4028  }

4033  std::unique_ptr<std::string> env(const std::string& var);

4036  std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string& s, char delimiter = '\n');
4037

4039  std::string stripWhitespace(const std::string& s);

4041  template<typename T, typename... Args>
4042  std::unique_ptr<T> makeUnique(Args&&... args)
4043  {
4044  return std::unique_ptr<T>(new T(std::forward<Args>(args)...));
4045  }
4046 
4047  template<typename T>
4048  std::unique_ptr<T> clone(const T& t)
4049  {
4050  return makeUnique<T>(t);
4051  }
4052 
4053  template<typename T>
4054  std::unique_ptr<T> maybeClone(const T* t)
4055  {
4056  if (t) return makeUnique<T>(*t);
4057  else return std::unique_ptr<T>();
4058  }

4731 /** @brief The primary interface for storage abstraction.
4732  *
4733  * The Arbiter is the primary layer of abstraction for all supported Driver
4734  * instances, allowing remote paths to be treated as a simple filesystem or
4735  * key-value store. Routing to specialized drivers is based on a substring
4736  * comparison of an incoming path's delimited type, for example
4737  * `http://arbiter.io/data.txt` would route to the HTTP driver and
4738  * `s3://my-bucket/data.txt` would route to the S3 driver. Paths containing
4739  * no prefixed type information are routed to the filesystem driver.
4740  *
4741  * All Arbiter operations are thread-safe except unless otherwise noted.
4742  */
4743 class ARBITER_DLL Arbiter
4744 {
4745 public:
4746  /** Construct a basic Arbiter with only drivers the don't require
4747  * external configuration parameters.
4748  */
4749  Arbiter();
4750 
4751  /** @brief Construct an Arbiter with driver configurations. */
4752  Arbiter(const Json::Value& json);
4753 
4754  /** True if a Driver has been registered for this file type. */
4755  bool hasDriver(std::string path) const;
4756 
4757  /** @brief Add a custom driver for the supplied type.
4758  *
4759  * After this operation completes, future requests into arbiter beginning
4760  * with the prefix @p type followed by the delimiter `://` will be routed
4761  * to the supplied @p driver. If a Driver of type @p type already exists,
4762  * the supplied @p driver will replace it.
4763  *
4764  * This operation will throw ArbiterError if @p driver is empty.
4765  *
4766  * @note This operation is not thread-safe.
4767  */
4768  void addDriver(std::string type, std::unique_ptr<Driver> driver);
4769 
4770  /** Get data or throw if inaccessible. */
4771  std::string get(std::string path) const;
4772 
4773  /** Get data if accessible. */
4774  std::unique_ptr<std::string> tryGet(std::string path) const;
4775 
4776  /** Get data in binary form or throw if inaccessible. */
4777  std::vector<char> getBinary(std::string path) const;
4778 
4779  /** Get data in binary form if accessible. */
4780  std::unique_ptr<std::vector<char>> tryGetBinary(std::string path) const;
4781 
4782  /** Get file size in bytes or throw if inaccessible. */
4783  std::size_t getSize(std::string path) const;
4784 
4785  /** Get file size in bytes if accessible. */
4786  std::unique_ptr<std::size_t> tryGetSize(std::string path) const;
4787 
4788  /** Write data to path. */
4789  void put(std::string path, const std::string& data) const;
4790 
4791  /** Write data to path. */
4792  void put(std::string path, const std::vector<char>& data) const;
4793

4795  * isHttpDerived is false for this path. */

4797  std::string path,
4798  http::Headers headers,
4799  http::Query query = http::Query()) const;

4807

4810  std::vector<char> getBinary(
4811  std::string path,
4812  http::Headers headers,
4813  http::Query query = http::Query()) const;
4814

4817  std::unique_ptr<std::vector<char>> tryGetBinary(

4838  /** Copy data from @p src to @p dst. @p src will be resolved with
4839  * Arbiter::resolve prior to the copy, so globbed directories are supported.
4840  * If @p src ends with a slash, it will be resolved with a recursive glob,
4841  * in which case any nested directory structure will be recreated in @p dst.
4842  *
4843  * If @p dst is a filesystem path, fs::mkdirp will be called prior to the
4844  * start of copying. If @p src is a recursive glob, `fs::mkdirp` will
4845  * be repeatedly called during copying to ensure that any nested directories
4846  * are reproduced.
4847  */
4848  void copy(std::string src, std::string dst, bool verbose = false) const;

4851  * with a `/` or '\' character, then @p file will be copied into the
4852  * directory @p to with the basename of @p file. If @p does not end with a
4853  * slash character, then @p to will be interpreted as a file path.
4854  *
4855  * If @p to is a local filesystem path, then `fs::mkdirp` will be called
4856  * prior to copying.
4857  */
4858  void copyFile(std::string file, std::string to, bool verbose = false) const;

4885  /** @brief Resolve a possibly globbed path.
4886  *
4887  * If @p path ends with `*`, then this operation will attempt to
4888  * non-recursively glob all files matching the given wildcard. Directories
4889  * matching the wildcard and their contents are not returned.
4890  *
4891  * Examples:
4892  * @code
4893  * // Returns all files in `~/data`. A directory `~/data/dir/` and its
4894  * // contents would not be returned since this is non-recursive.
4895  * a.resolve("~\data\*");
4896  *
4897  * // Returns all files matching `prefix-*` in bucket `my-bucket`. An
4898  * // object `s3://my-bucket/prefix-123/hello.txt` would not be returned,
4899  * // but object `s3://my-bucket/prefix-456.txt` would.
4900  * a.resolve("s3://my-bucket/prefix-*");
4901  * @endcode
4902  *
4903  * @note Throws ArbiterError if the selected driver does not support
4904  * globbing, for example the HTTP driver.
4905  *
4906  * @param path Path to search, may be a directory or file. Globbing
4907  * will only occur in the case of a directory.
4908  *
4909  * @param verbose If true, driver-specific status information may be
4910  * printed to STDOUT during globbing.
4911  *
4912  * @return If @p path ends with `*`, the results are the contents of the
4913  * resulting non-recursive resolution of this path. Otherwise, the results
4914  * are a vector of size one containing only @p path itself, unaltered.
4915  */
4916  std::vector<std::string> resolve(
4917  std::string path,
4918  bool verbose = false) const;
4919 
4920  /** @brief Get a reusable Endpoint for this root directory. */
4921  Endpoint getEndpoint(std::string root) const;
4922 
4923  /** Returns the Driver, if one can be found, for the given @p path. The
4924  * driver type is determined from the @p path substring prior to the
4925  * delimiter `://`. If this delimiter does not exist, then the filesystem
4926  * driver is returned. If the delimiter exists but a corresponding driver
4927  * type is not found, ArbiterError is thrown.
4928  *
4929  * Optionally, filesystem paths may be explicitly prefixed with `file://`.
4930  */
4931  const Driver& getDriver(std::string path) const;
4932 
4933  /** @brief Get a fs::LocalHandle to a possibly remote file.
4934  *
4935  * If @p path is remote (see Arbiter::isRemote), this operation will fetch
4936  * the file contents and write them to the local filesystem in the
4937  * directory represented by @p tmpEndpoint. The contents of @p path are
4938  * not copied if @p path is already local.
4939  *
4940  * There are no filename guarantees if @p path is remote. Use
4941  * LocalHandle::localPath to determine this.
4942  *
4943  * @note This operation will throw an ArbiterError if the path is remote
4944  * and @p tmpEndpoint is also remote.
4945  *
4946  * @param path Possibly remote path to fetch.
4947  *
4948  * @param tempEndpoint If @path is remote, the local copy will be created
4949  * at this Endpoint.
4950  *
4951  * @return A fs::LocalHandle for local access to the resulting file.
4952  */
4953  std::unique_ptr<fs::LocalHandle> getLocalHandle(
4954  std::string path,
4955  const Endpoint& tempEndpoint) const;
4956 
4957  /** @brief Get a fs::LocalHandle to a possibly remote file.
4958  *
4959  * If @p tempPath is not specified, the environment will be searched for a
4960  * temporary location.
4961  */
4962  std::unique_ptr<fs::LocalHandle> getLocalHandle(
4963  std::string path,
4964  std::string tempPath = "") const;

4967  * the substring prior to but not including this delimiter.
4968  */
4969  static std::string getType(std::string path);

4980  */
4981  http::Pool& httpPool() { return *m_pool; }
